Natividad, is a very hardworking mother, she sells various articles according to the seasons in which families need those articles in particular, to satisfy their needs. For a long time, her work has contributed notably to the development of her family. Her husband earns a very low income, and therefore Natividad works to compensate for the difference the family needs financially. The desire of this hard-working mother is to buy a motorized tricycle to offer her products in a consistent way along the streets of her city and the adjoining districts in order to increase her profits and to elevate the quality of life of her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad, es una madre de familia muy esforzada, labora vendiendo artículos de acuerdo a las temporadas en las que las familias requieren de artículos en particular para satisfacer sus necesidades. Por mucho tiempo esta ha sido la actividad que ha contribuido notablemente con el desarrollo de su familia y la razón de su esfuerzo es debido a que su esposo por la labor que desempeña percibe muy bajos ingresos. El deseo de esta trabajadora madre es comprar un triciclo motorizado para ofertar sus productos de manera constante por las calles de su ciudad y los distritos aledaños a ella a fin de incrementar sus ganancias y elevar la calidad de vida de su querida familia.

loans.use: To Buy a Motorized Tricycle

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia, is very hard working and she demonstrates this by supporting her parents through her agricultural activities. This help and knowledge has allowed her to get involved more with this activity and now she grows potatoes and corn, also with the help of her husband she has purchased a motortaxi which they use to dedicate themselves to the manufacturing of bricks in their small workshop. The strength that this pair possesses has helped them to succeed with each task they do and thanks to their daily work their two children have health and security. This spring season the requests increased and they cannot get enough material to manufacture their products, because of this they seek your help with the objective of obtaining the quantity that they request to fulfill all the demands.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenobia, es muy trabajadora y eso lo demostró cuando apoyaba a sus padres en el desempeño de sus actividades agrícolas, esta ayuda y conocimiento le ha permitido involucrarse mucho más con esta actividad y ahora siembra papa y maíz, también con ayuda de su esposo ha comprado un mototaxi el cual dan en alquiler para dedicarse por entero a la fabricación de tejas en su pequeño taller.La fortaleza que esta pareja posee los ha ayudado a alcanzar cada una de las cosas que se han propuesto y gracias a su desempeño diario pueden otorgarle bienestar y seguridad a sus dos pequeños hijos. Durante esta temporada las solicitudes se incrementan y no disponen de suficiente materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos, por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda con el objetivo de obtener la cantidad que solicitan para concretar cada una de las solicitudes que albergan en su taller.

loans.use: To increase capital to acquire a better quantity of material for the manufacture of bricks.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor is a native of Huertas, an agriculture zone in which the inhabitants dedicate themselves to the manufacture of brickwork and bricks, throughout her infancy she dedicated herself to the knowledge of the manufacturing of bricks, her skill and effort in this activity today serves her and helps to sustain the economy of her home, she is happily married and has 3 children whom she watched with much happiness and cares for because she wants them to form good habits that will allow them to be honorable. She has completed 10 years of work and is very content because her bricks are the most wanted in her area thanks to the excellent quality of their components. Her desire to establish a cattle farming space to satisfy the necessities of her family without obstacles during the time in which the demand for her bricks decreases, she knows that money is very important and she wants to initiate this project by requesting a loan for the purchase of a cow.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor, es natural de Huertas, una zona agrícola en la que sus pobladores se dedican en su mayoría a la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, es así que durante toda su infancia ella se ha dedicado al conocimiento y a la fabricación de tejas, su destreza y esfuerzo en esta actividad hoy le sirve y es un sostén en la economía de su hogar, ella está felizmente casada y tiene 3 hijos a quienes atiende con mucha alegría y cuida porque quiere formarlos con buenos hábitos que les permita ser honrados.Ha cumplido diez años de trabajo y está muy contenta de que sus tejas sean las más solicitadas en el lugar que habitan gracias a la excelente calidad de sus componentes. Su deseo es establecer un espacio ganadero a fin de satisfacer las necesidades de su familia sin obstáculos durante el tiempo en el que la solicitud de las tejas disminuyan, sabe que para este hecho es muy importante el dinero e inversión y desea iniciar este gran trayecto solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaca.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Like a good son that has to reward his mother for all the care that she gave him when he was littler, Luis, works diligently and makes an effort each day to satisfy the necessities of his old mother and collaborate with his older brothers, due to the fact that the brick factory they have is going through a major crisis, for this reason he has decided to obtain some help for his work to contribute to his family until this difficult time is resolved. He solicits the loan to relaunch his small factory and from now on he has proposed to work on both activities to save enough to avoid these difficult times in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Como buen hijo que tiene que retribuir a su madre por todo el cuidado que le brindó cuando era pequeño, Luis, trabaja denodadamente y se esfuerza día a día para satisfacer las necesidades de su anciana madre y colaborar con sus hermanos mayores, debido a que la fábrica de ladrillos que poseen está atravesando por una notable crisis, por esa razón ha decidido adquirir ésta herramienta de trabajo a fin de contribuir con su familia hasta que esta penosa época se resuelva rápidamente.Solicita el préstamo para reflotar su pequeña fábrica en poco tiempo y de ahora en adelante se ha propuesto trabajar en ambas actividades a fin de ahorrar para evitar estas dificultades a futuro.

loans.use: To increase his capital to relaunch his small factory.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, is very connected to the labor of manufacturing brickworks and bricks for his family and has embarked on the construction of a bakery and with your help he wants to offer a variety of delicious breads to his community. His energy and hard working spirit has driven him down this path and he has it in his head to be able to offer a safe place to work for many young people in the city. With your help this young entrepreneur will realize his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier, está muy vinculada a la labor de fabricación de tejas y ladrillos de su querida familia y ha emprendido la construcción de una panadería con su ayuda, desde la cual desea ofrecer una deliciosa variedad de panes a su comunidad. El ímpetu y su espíritu trabajador lo han conducido por el camino de los grandes propósitos y tiene en mente echar a andar este lugar para poder otorgar a jóvenes de su ciudad un espacio seguro de trabajo.Con tu ayuda este emprendedor joven hará realidad su sueño preciado.

loans.use: The implementation of a small bakery.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther knows the activities of agriculture and cattle farming very well due to the fact that since she was very young she was linked to this labor through her family. When she constructed her own home the necessities pressured her and the small earnings that her husband earned away from the city were not enough to supply the necessities of their children, it was in this moment that she decided to take the reins of her home and begin to grow potatoes, corn and alfalfa, this last product gives daily nutrition to the little cows that she acquired later on; she has been dedicating herself to this labor for 10 years and things in her home have gotten better, her husband continues working outside the city and her children have not left their studies and they are able to receive daily sustenance thanks to their mother’s efforts. With the desire of increasing the production of her fields she solicits a loan to acquire a better quantity of manure fertilizers to obtain a harvest of better size and quality next season.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther, conoce muy el trabajo en la actividad agrícola y ganadera debido a que desde muy niña ha estado vinculada a esta labor por su familia.Cuando construyó su propio hogar las necesidades la apremiaban y el pequeño sueldo que percibía su esposo fuera de su ciudad no era suficiente para abastecer las necesidades de sus pequeños, fue este el momento en el que ella decidió tomar las riendas de su hogar y empezar a sembrar papa, maíz y alfalfa, este último productos para otorgarles alimento diario a las pequeñas vaquitas que adquirió poco tiempo después; lleva dedicándose a esta labor diez años y las cosas dentro de su hogar han mejorado notablemente, su esposo sigue trabajando fuera de la ciudad y sus pequeños no han dejado de estudiar y de percibir el sustento diario gracias al esfuerzo de su mamá.Con el deseo de incrementar la producción de sus campos solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes a fin de obtener esta próxima cosecha alimentos de mejor tamaño y calidad.

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Elsa, 32, lives in Managua's Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She's married and her husband earns a modest wage working for the Nicaraguan army. They have two young children, a one-year old and a three-year old. With their senior years in mind, they've set up a business, started by Elsa, selling light meals: fried pork, hamburgers and cold drinks. She's managed to operate the business for 8 years now. With the income from the business, Elsa has been able to improve her house little by little. It's walls aren't made of concrete, though, and the makeshift electricals are old. This loan will help her make additional improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elsa Núñez de 32 años de edad habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el ejercito en el cual gana un modesto salario con el cual asume los gastos del hogar. Tienen dos hijos pequeños uno de 1 año y el otro de 3 años de edad. Juntos lograron poner un negocio pensando en su vejez el cual inicio doña Elsa N. vendiendo carne de cerdo frito con toritilla, hamburguesas y Refrescos. Logró montar un pequeño negocio de venta de comida casera desde hace ya 8 años. De este negocio ha podido doña Elsa mejorar su vivienda de poco a poco, sus paredes no son de concretos y el sistema eléctrico es improvisado y viejo, este prestamos le ayudara a mejorar su hogar.

loans.use: Build cement walls, install new electricals and new floors.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mayra Nicolasa

texts.es:
Mayra is an hard-working and fighting 48-year-old woman. A single woman, she lives in a neighborhood that goes by the name of Hialeah. Her only company is her older daughter who works and helps out financially, and her 17-year-old son who she supports so he can do well. When in her youth she took on the responsibility to bring a son to this world, she began to sell used clothes and with the profits that she obtained she opened a store that she has maintained with love and dedication for 10 years. She is a woman who is on her feet from 4 in the morning each day to have her house and store ready as soon as the first ray of sun arrives. With the profits of their daily work, she is satisfied with the improvements that she has managed to make to their humble dwelling. She has invested in finishing a room and at last there is little that she needs. She requests this loan to buy materials that will permit her to finish it such as: cement, boards and iron. This is because she shares her room with her son and wants to finish this room to give privacy to her son; a room that he started to construct with his own humble effort.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mayra es una esforzada y luchadora mujer de 48 años de edad, soltera, habita en un barrio de nombre Hialeah, sus únicas compañías su hija mayor que trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su hijo de 17 años de edad a quien aun apoya para salir adelante, cuando en su juventud inició la responsabilidad de traer un hijo a este mundo empezó a vender ropa usada y de las ganancias que consiguió logro poner una pulpería que mantiene con amor y dedicación desde hace 10 años, es mujer de estar en pies desde las 4 de la mañana de cada día para tener su c asa y pulpería lista en cuanto sale el primer rayo de sol. De las ganancias de su trabajo diario mira satisfecha lo agradable que ha logrado poner su humilde vivienda, ha invertido en la terminación de un cuarto y finalmente es poco lo que falta por lo que solicita este préstamo para comprar materiales que le permitan terminarlo como son: cemento, tablas y hierro. Esto es porque comparte su cuarto con su hijo y quiere terminar este cuarto para darle privacidad a su hijo varón, cuarto que inició su construcción con su humilde esfuerzo.

loans.use: To buy iron, cement, boards, and quarried stone.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto lives in a community that lacks industrial and commercial jobs. Due to these circumstances, he decided to become self-employed and thus not have to immigrate to the United States. He started selling clothes and other articles little by little. Soon he became known in his community and now sells blankets and clothing.

Rigoberto tells us that he has many pending blanket orders. This is the reason he is asking for a loan of $200 that he will pay back in 6 months. With this money, Rigoberto will be able to buy more merchandise in order to have a larger variety and fulfill his pending orders. With your help, Rigoberto and his family will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Rigoberto, vive en una comunidad en dónde no existen industrias u otras compañías para trabajar. Por falta de trabajo fue por la que decidió auto-emplearse y así no emigrar hacia Estados Unidos. Comenzó poco a poco a vender ropa y otros artículos. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocido en su comunidad y actualmente vende colchas y ropa.

Rigoberto comenta que tiene varios pedidos de colchas pendientes. Y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rigoberto podrá comprar más mercancía para así tener variedad y surtir los pedidos que le hicieron. Con tu ayuda Rigoberto podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
The strength and the unshakable fortitude of Sonia have allowed her and her family to remain united and enjoy their wellbeing. For a long time she has been dedicated to agriculture and cattle farming, and for a bit, the manufacturing of bricks and it is with this activity that she has been able to satisfy many desires in a short time. However, her yearnings and desires have not been satisfied completely due to the necessity of capital and precisely for this motive she turns to you in search of help to inject a bit of capital into her livelihood so that she will be secure and will continue in happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La fuerza y la inquebrantable fortaleza de Sonia ha permitido durante muchos que su querida familia se mantenga unida u gocen de bienestar.Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace poco a la fabricación de ladrillos y es con esta actividad que ha podido albergar en poco tiempo muchas satisfacciones y desea continuar su travesía implementando mejor su espacio de trabajo, sin embargo las ansias y deseos nop han sido cubiertos debido a la falta de capital y precisamente por este motivo recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de inyectarle un poco de capital a esta su ocupación que está segura dentro de poco le seguirá dando inmensas alegrías.

loans.use: Increase of Capital to increase the production of bricks.

loans.name: Visitación

texts.es:
Day after day, Visitación struggles to overcome the economic crisis she endured for years. Due to the social consequences attached to it, she was unable to receive an education, but life’s lessons taught her to be prudent and skillful in the livestock business. She is a widow and lived alone for years. Now she lives with her elderly mother, her 25-year-old daughter and her granddaughter, to whom she gives all her love and affection. Together they unite to combine their efforts and carry out this labor, which tends to be very difficult.

Visitación tends to her cow and her sheep. Of the first, she sells its milk which is her livelihood, and the latter she offers for sale in the Chupaca fair during the weekends. Her wish is to use her savings as capital to purchase land so that she may also harvest potatoes and corn. This hard-working mother’s wish of acquiring a cow to benefit her family leads her to request your help through a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Visitación día a día lucha por superar la situación de crisis económica por la que atravesó por años, debido a la misma coyuntura social no accedió a estudiar pero las lecciones de la vida le enseñaron a ser prudente y hábil en el negocio del ganado, ella es viuda y por años vivió así, ahora vive con su anciana madre, su hija de 25 años y una nieta a la cual brinda todo su cariño a amor y juntas se unen para reunir esfuerzos y dedicarse a estas tareas que muchas veces suele ser dura, se dedica a cuidar a su vaca y a sus ovejas, de la primera vende diariamente la leche que le sirve de sustento y a las segundas las oferta en la feria de Chupaca los fines de semana. Su deseo es poder capitalizar algunos ahorro que tiene para comprar terrenos a fin de dedicarse también a la siembra de papa y maíz.El deseo de esta trabajadora madre de adquirir una vaca más para beneficio de su familia la conducen a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a cow.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is a young man filled with hopes and dreams. He studied Agronomy at the university and has since learned his craft closely with much practice and effort. He offers livestock and agricultural manor services to people that request it and breeds bees in an area of his home. Every week, he extracts honey from the space where he houses the bees to sell in his older brothers’ stores. His wish is to contribute to the tranquility of his elderly mother and has decided to increase the artificial honeycombs he has at home and set up an area to counsel the people in his town.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel, es un joven lleno de sueños y esperanzas, estudió Agronomía en la universidad y desde ese entonces con mucho esfuerzo y práctica ha conocido su profesión de cerca, presta servicios de señoría ganadera y agrícola a las personas que lo solicitan y está criando abejas en un espacio de su casa, semanalmente del lugar que les ha otorgado como morada de reposo extrae miel para comercializarla en las tiendas de sus hermanos mayores.Su deseo es contribuir con la tranquilidad de su anciana madre y ha decidido incrementar lo panales artificiales que posee en casa e implementar el espacio para asesorar desde este lugar a los pobladores de su ciudad.

loans.use: Inject capital to increase the quantity of artificial honeycombs and expand a section of his house to use as a counseling area.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Ten years ago Bertha started selling a small amount of groceries out of her home as her husband was unemployed. Little by little she became known and today this business is their only source of reliable income. For this reason, Bertha wishes to increase her sales in order to get ahead.

Bertha is asking for a $300 loan that she will pay back in 6 months. With this money Bertha will be able to buy more merchandise and increase the variety of her products to keep her clientele from shopping at her competitors. With your help Bertha will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 10 años que Bertha comenzó a vender un poco de mercancía de abarrotes en su casa. Puesto que su esposo no tenía trabajo. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y hoy este negocio es la única fuente de trabajo con la que cuenta. Es por eso que Bertha desea poder incrementar sus ventas para poder salir adelante.

Bertha está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Bertha podrá comprar más mercancía para tener variedad en su negocio y así sus clientes no se vayan con la competencia. Con tu ayuda Bertha logrará sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Florinda is a working mother of a family who, despite their permanent residence in the city, managed to acquire a small cow a few years ago to help out with the well-being of her beloved family. Eugenia, the little cow, provides a lot of milk every day, and Florinda goes to her cousin's house near the city where the cow lives so that she can bring back this precious liquid and sell it in the city. Due to the rhythms of her job, she has constant customers thanks to the purity of this milk. Florinda's wish is to acquire some land where she can grow forage for her cow and alfalfa for her newest residents, a large number of guinea pigs that very quickly began being bred and sold in the Sunday market of Huancayo. Your important help will contribute to solidifying this new little breeding center of Florinda's.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Florinda, es una trabajadora madre de familia que a pesar de su permanencia constante en la ciudad ha podido adquirir una pequeña vaca hace varios años para colaborar con el bienestar de su querida familia.Eugenia, así llama a su vaquita, le provee de mucha leche diariamente y ella se desplaza a la casa de su prima cerca de la ciudad en donde permanece la vaquita, para llevar a comercializar este preciado líquido a su ciudad. Debido al ritmo de su trabajo tiene clientes constantes por la pureza de la misma.El deseo de Doña Florinda, es adquirir terrenos de cultivo para sembrar forraje para su vaquita y alfalfa para sus nuevos inquilinos, una importante cantidad de cuyes que hace poco a adquirido para reproducirlos y venderlos en la feria dominical de Huancayo.Tu importante ayuda contribuirá a la consolidación del pequeño centro de crianza de Doña Florinda.

loans.use: Purchase of land for growing forage and alfalfa for her little animals

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Mrs. Delia, as hard-working as always, is ready to get ahead and make herself useful. She says that she carries youth in her heart everyday, and that's the reason she decided to sell various types of foods seven years ago, particularly her chicken soup. This business makes her happy because she also has the opportunity to try a delicious chicken soup while sharing it with others. Day after day, she gets up at dawn to make, in addition to this tasty dish, the well-known national food cau-cau, and various hot coffees to suit the cold season. She dreams of having a big restaurant where she can prepare and server an immense variety of specials. Her efforts all go toward her dream of sending her children to the university in the city. With this loan, she will purchase more china, spoons, and cooking utensils to improve those that she has and also to improve the facility where she serves her famous chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Delia, como siempre tan trabajadora esta presta a seguir adelante y a sentirse útil, la juventud se lleva en el corazón es lo que dice cada día y esta la razón por la que ha decidido vender diversos tipos de comidas, especialmente caldo de gallina hace 7 años, este negocio es de su agrado porque también tiene la oportunidad de probar un suculento caldo de gallina y compartir con los suyos. Día a día se levanta de madrugada para preparar además de este delicioso plato, cau cau plato nacional muy conocido y adicionalmente ofrece cafecitos calientes para esta época de frío.Aspira tener un restaurante grande donde pueda preparar y ofrecer una inmensa variedad de especialidades. Sus esfuerzos tienen el propósito de ayudar a cumplir los sueños de sus hijos que estudian en la universidad de su ciudad.Con el préstamo que obtenga comprará más platos de lozas, cucharas y utensilios de cocina para renovar los que ya tiene y también para mejorar las instalaciones en las que ofrece su conocido caldo de gallina.

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 38693

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a single mother of two children that are 16 and 22. Since they were very young, Martha has worked to pay the household bills and her children’s expenses. There was a time however, that what she earned was not enough and this is when she decided to start her seamstress business. Little by little she became known and now makes uniforms and various articles of clothing for her clients.

Today she has many pending orders and doesn’t have enough material to produce them. This is why she is asking for a loan of $575 which she will pay back in 6 months. With this money Martha will be able to buy the necessary materials to fulfill the orders. With your help Martha will be able to help her children get ahead by supporting them as they finish their college studies.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es madre soltera de dos hijos quienes actualmente tienen 16 y 22 años. Desde que eran muy pequeños Martha a trabajado para poder pagar los gastos de su casa y de sus hijos. Sin embargo hubo un tiempo en que con lo que ganaba no era suficiente. Y fue por eso que decidió comenzar su negocio de elaboración de prendas. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida. Actualmente ya elabora uniformes y otras prendas para sus clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos de prendas y no cuenta con el material suficiente para elaborarlos, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá comprar los materiales necesarios para elaborar los productos. Con tu ayuda Martha logrará sacar adelante a sus hijos para que terminen de estudiar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: To buy material to make clothes.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Because Patricia’s family always told her she was a natural cook, she had the idea to sell prepared foods and started selling small bites from her house 5 years ago. Little by little, her delicious dishes became known in her neighborhood. She also makes dishes for schools near her house.

However, Patricia does not have a fully outfitted business. This is why she is asking for a $475 loan that she will pay back in 6 months. With this loan Patricia will be able to buy chairs, tables, and a pair of grills to make more food in less time. With your help Patricia will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La familia de Patricia siempre le decía que tenia buen sazón para la comida así le nació la idea de que podía poner su propio puesto de comidas y empezó con la venta de antojitos en su domicilio desde hace 5 años, y poco a poco la gente de su colonia fue conociendo los ricos guisos. Actualmente surte antojitos en escuelas cercanas a su casa.

Sin embargo Patricia no cuenta con una buena adecuación de su negocio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Patricia podrá comprar mobiliario para si negocio como; sillas, mesas y un par de parrillas para poder elaborar más productos en menos tiempo. Con tu ayuda Patricia logrará sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a pair of grills.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria has three children, of which one is unfortunately sick with leukemia. In order to help her husband who works as an interior decorator, Gloria has been selling home cooked meals to her customers and neighbors for 8 years. This work has helped very much, as her husband's salary alone is insufficient to cover their son's medications and daily family expenses.

Gloria is requesting a loan of $475 which she will repay within 6 months. With the money Gloria will buy more merchandise so that she is able to sell her food to more people. With your help Gloria will be able to move her business forward so that she can pay for her son's medications.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Gloria tiene tres hijos, de los cuales uno desafortunadamente se encuentra enfermo de Leucemia. Para poder ayudarle a su esposo quien trabaja como instalador de interiores, y lo que gana no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de los medicamentos y de la casa fue por lo que Gloria comenzó a vender comidas en su casa a sus clientes y vecinos desde hace 8 años.

Actualmente Gloria está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Gloria podrá comprar más mercancía para así tener para vender a más personas. Con tu ayuda Gloria logrará sacar su negocio adelante para poder pagarle los medicamentos a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angelica Maria C. Hernández is a twenty-eight-year-old farmer. In spite of being so young, she has learned to work the land. She lives in Ticuantepe and her main source of income is working the land. Angelica uses some of her land to harvest pineapples and the other to harvest bananas. While one portion of the land is being used to produce pineapples, the remaining of the land is given maintenance in order to keep the quality of the crop. She is a single mother and has two children. The father of the children helps her with the school expenses for the children but Angelica takes cares of the rest of the expenses. She is a tenacious lady who has raised and supported her children by harvesting pineapple and bananas. While the crops are getting ready so they can be sold, Angelica buys produce from other producers and sells them in the city streets using a wicker basket, which helps her generate additional monthly income. Angelica needs this loan to buy products to maintain her crops, which represent the largest part of her income.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica Maria C. Hernández, es una mujer agricultora de veintiocho años de edad, a pesar de ser joven ha aprendido a trabajar la tierra, habita en Ticuantepe y su principal fuente de trabajo es el trabajo en la tierra ella siembra una manzana de piña y media de plátano mientras una produce, a la otra se le da mantenimiento para no perder la calidad de la cosecha. Ella es madre soltera de dos hijos el padre de los niños le ayuda con los gastos de colegio de sus hijos y el resto corree por su cuenta. Es mujer luchadora que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con la siembra de piña y plátano mientras sale la cosecha compra productos varios a otros productores y los vende en canasto en las calles de la ciudad lo que le genera ingresos mensuales. Necesita su préstamo para comprar productos de mantenimiento de la cosecha la cual representa su mejor ingreso.

loans.use: To Buy Products to Maintain the Crop

loans.name: Elias Jose

texts.es:
Elias P., is a 25 years old young man, who got married at a very young age and who lives with his wife and two children in Ticuantepe. To support his family, Elias works the land with his father-in-law who yielded a portion of his land sp Elias could harvest pineapple and thus to support them to do well and advance in life. As a good son-in-law, he works on his crop and supports his father-in-law, as his wife takes care of the children and the home. In order to have another source of income, Elias works with wood in a carpentry. He needs the loan to buy supplies to maintain his crop, which is important to harvest a high-quality product and therefore, ask for a better and more competitive price. A successful crop will allow him and his wife to buy school supplies for their children and some household goods for his wife and the home.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Elias P., es un joven de 25 años, que a muy temprana edad se caso y habita con su joven esposa y sus dos niños pequeños en Ticuantepe, para mantener a su familia trabaja la tierra con su suegro quien le cedió 2 manzanas de tierra para cosechar piña y así apoyarlos a salir adelante, como buen yerno trabaja su cosecha y apoya a su suegro ya que su esposa se mantiene al cuido de los niños y el hogar. Como otro ingreso trabaja con madera en una carpintería ahora necesita su préstamo para comprar insumos de mantenimiento de la cosecha que es importante para lograr un producto de alta calidad y le puedan pagar un mejor precio por su cosecha que le permitirá comprar a sus hijos los materiales escolares pendientes y algunos enseres para su esposa en la casa.

loans.use: To Buy Supplies for Crop Maintenance

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael A., is a 25 years old, hard-working young man. When he was a little boy his parents taught him the precious value of working. Michael married a beautiful young lady from his hometown of Ticuantepe. Michael and his wife live with their in-laws. The young couple has two children, one of the children is still a newborn. Preoccupied about his family, Michael works at a gas station as a service technician, and with his salary and the help of his father-in-law, he has begun the construction of his future home in a terrain in front of his father-in-law’s house. Michael managed to buy the land with the hopes of owning a home. Michael’s wife also began selling beauty products and cosmetics in order to support her husband and realize their dream of owing a home. Michael needs this loan to buy construction materials so their humble house can quickly become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Michael A., es un joven trabajador de 25 años que desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron el precioso valor del trabajo, se caso con una linda joven de su pueblo Ticuantepe y actualmente vive con ella en casa de sus suegros en donde ha procreado dos hijos, uno tras otro de brazos aun, así que preocupado por su familia trabaja en una Gasolinera como Técnico de servicio y con su ingreso y apoyo de sus suegro ha empezado la construcción de su vivienda en un terreno frente a la casa de su suegro que logró comprar con la ilusión de vivir solos. También su esposa empezó a vender cosméticos a domicilio al crédito para apoyarlo en el sueño de su casa. Necesita este préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y que su humilde casa pronto sea una realidad.

loans.use: To Buy Construction Materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es:
Miguel is a 33-year-old man that lives in Ticuantepe, where he harvests pineapples and bananas. Miguel had the fortune to marry a woman of the region. She is hard-working and with an obvious impetus to succeed. When Miguel and his wife do not have harvests of their own, his wife purchases produce from other farmers and using her wicker basket she sells the products from house to house, and even at the local market. The couple has two children, who do not lack school education or the example of hard-working parents. As good farmers, Miguel and his wife know that this is the time to give the adequate maintenance to their crop in order to assure the quality of their product, and this is why they need this loan, to buy the necessary supplies for the maintenance of their pineapple harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel es un hombre de 33 años de edad que habita en Ticuantepe donde cosecha 1 manzanas de piña y dos de plátano. Tiene la fortuna de estar casado con una mujer de la región, trabajadora y con ímpetu de superación por lo que cuando no tienen cosecha propia su esposa compra a otros productores y sale a vender en canasto de casa en casa, de venta en venta y hasta en los mercados. Tienen 2 hijos preadolescentes a quienes no les falta para sus educación escolar ni le falta ejemplo de trabajo de sus padres, como buenos agricultores saben que esta es la época de darle mantenimiento a sus cosecha para tener calidad en su producto por lo que necesitan este préstamo para comprar los insumos para mantenimiento de piña.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva V. R. owns her own business working as a seamstress in the city of Morales, San Martin. She started the business from her living room in 2000 because she had a useful skill, wanted to take charge of her life, and did not want to rely on her husband. Now she makes and sells custom bedspreads, blankets, and covers to her neighbors, friends, and family.

Genoveva is 34 years old, married and has three children. She is happy that she can work from home so that she can also take care of her children. Genoveva is proud to be a productive member of her community and a positive role model for her children. Her goal is to save enough money to send all of her children to university so they can have more opportunities in life than she had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Las Moralinas, Genoveva is requesting a loan of $525 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would like to buy a selection of new fabrics and threads so she can offer her clients different, creative products.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy a selection of new fabrics and threads

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Julio V. is a 48 year-old working man used to working the harvest from sun-up to sun-down. He lives in Ticuantepe with his wife who is very hard-working, characteristic of the women from the area. Mr. V. and his wife had 4 children together and work harvesting 4 lots of land. They grow pineapples, pitaya (a local fruit), and coffee in their field. Their work supports the family.

Mr. V. and his wife have been able to sell basic grains for the citizens of their community. Their customers provide them with ample income, which supports all domestic expenditures. Mr. V. works the field while his wife is the administrator and accountant of the family business. They need a loan because it is a crucial hour for their crops -- they need to be maintained so that they are high-quality at harvest time. In their region the pineapple is famous for its sweet and rich flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

El señor Julio V., hombre trabajador de 48 años, forjado con el trabajo de la tierra de sol a sol, habita en Ticuantepe con una buena mujer trabajadora como es característica de las mujeres de esa tierra, con la que procreo 4 hijos y cultivan 4 manzanas de tierras entre piña, pitaya y café, con lo que han sustentado a su familia. Gracias a que han formado un buena sociedad conyugal a parte de la cosecha lograron poner una venta de granos básicos para los habitantes de la comunidad la cual les da buenos ingresos que apoyan a los gastos de su hogar, Don Julio trabaja la tierra y su señora es la mujer de las finanzas y administradora de las ganancias del negocio familiar. Necesitan un préstamo porque estamos en época de dar mantenimiento al cultivo para que este mantenga su calidad a la hora de la cosecha, en esta zona la piña es famosa por su sabor dulce y exquisito.

loans.use: Compra de Insmuo para mantenimiento de Piña

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita R. R. has a business cutting hair in the city of Morales, San Martin. She loves providing a service and being a productive member of her community. Although she has worked with her family for much of her life, she started her own business four years ago to gain some independence.

Rosita is 31 years old, divorced, and has a son. She enjoys her independence and is happy that she can care for her son and pay for his education. Her family is very supportive of her business, and Rosita looks forward to sending her son to a university so he can have more opportunities in life than she had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Las Moralinas, Rosita is requesting a loan of $700 to repay over 6 months. She would use the extra capital to buy new clippers and make repairs to her shop.

loans.use: She would use the extra capital to buy new clippers and make repairs to her shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy V. C. runs a general store in the city of Morales, San Martin. In the store she sells a range of goods including: fruits, vegetables, sodas, beer, packaged foods, hygiene products, and meats. She started the store one year ago to help take charge of her life.

Lucy is 32 years old, single and has two daughters. She is glad that she started the store because now she has a large enough income to cover all of her family’s needs. Lucy is a very hard worker who wakes up at 5 a.m. to serve customers and take care of her family. She is happy she gets to work from home where she can spend time with her children.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Las Moralinas, Lucy is requesting a loan of $875 to repay over 6 months. With the extra capital she will purchase detergent, sugar, rice, and oil.

loans.use: With the extra capital she will purchase detergent, sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has a business selling Juane in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. Juane is a food typical of the region and culture of the Peruvian jungle; it is most often made of rice and chicken wrapped in a palm leaf. Ana is from Moyobamba where they add extra spices to their Juane. She continues to use this recipe and has received rave reviews. Ana has sold her Juane in Tarapoto for five years and now has numerous loyal customers. They tell her she has the tastiest Juane in town.

Ana is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She started the business to help her family and take charge of her life. She wakes up at 5 a.m. every morning to go sell her Juane in the main market. She returns home at lunch to start preparing Juane for the next day. Ana is happy that she can provide a better life and more opportunities for her children. She hopes to buy a computer for her children in the near future.

A member of the community bank Las Orquideas, Ana is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over 6 months. She would use the extra capital to buy oil, rice, chicken, pork, yucca, and corn. With the extra money Ana will be able to keep up with ever increasing demand.

loans.use: She would buy ingredients, including: oil, rice, chicken, pork, yucca and corn

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany runs a food stand in the neighborhood of Parta Alta in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She sells “Juane” (rice and chicken wrapped in a palm leaf), fried rice, french fries, and hot dogs. She prepares food daily to sell in the evening on the corner of a busy intersection near her house.

Dany is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her children are young, so she is happy that she can work from home during the day and spend time with them. She started the business 5 years ago to help earn money for her family and gain some independence. She now has many loyal customers and an active social life. She says she gets to meet people from all over the region, which she really enjoys. One day she would like to save enough money to send her children to university.

A member of the community bank Las Orquidias, Dany is requesting a loan of $425 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would like to buy new tables, plates, and cups so she can serve more customers.

loans.use: She would like to buy new tables, plates and cups

loans.name: Nélida

texts.es:
Nélida has a strong heart, which has helped her to overcome the hard knocks that life has given her, and look with optimism on the future. She lives alone with her children; her husband abandoned her some years ago, recently sending quantities of money that are sometimes not enough to keep up with the household's finances. That's why Nélida has always worked to provide her children with the support that they need. She initially devoted herself to crocheting, but three years ago she decided to purchase wholesale clothing to seel in the Jauja market on weekends. Currently the business is satisfying, and that's why she wants to increase her merchandise with the goal of increasing her earnings as well. In the future, she plans to establish herself in a retail location, since right now she sells on the street. Even more important, she has the satisfaction of watching her oldest daughter of 17 years' progress. Due to a fall when she was very young, she lost her sight entirely, but the darkness has not made her development impossible. This hard-working mother is requesting a loan to expand her merchandise in her clothing and jewelry store so that she can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Nélida tiene una gran fuerza de corazón que le permite resistir los duros golpes de la vida y mira con optimismo lo que ha de venir, ella vive sola con sus hijos, su esposo la abandonó hace varios años y recientemente manda cierta cantidad de dinero a veces insuficiente para sostener la economía de los suyos, por esa razón Nélida, desde siempre ha trabajado para brindarles a sus hijos el sustento que necesitan. Se dedicaba inicialmente a realizar tejidos a crochet y hace 3 años decidió comprar ropa al por mayor para venderla en la feria de Jauja los fines de semana, hasta el momento este negocio le ha otorgado satisfacciones y por ello desea incrementar su mercadería con el afán de acrecentar también sus ganancias, piensa a futuro estabilizarse en un local comercial porque por el momento el comercio que realiza es de manera ambulante, aún mas porque tiene la alegría el progreso de su hija mayor de 17 años, quien a raíz de una caída cuando todavía era muy pequeña perdió la vista por completo pero la oscuridad en la que está no ha imposibilitado su desarrollo.Está trabajadora madre solicita el préstamo para ampliar la mercadería de bisutería que ofrece a fin de incrementar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Increase the articles of jewelry and clothing to sell at her stand

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly lives in the Parta Alta neighborhood in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She owns a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has many loyal customers who are happy they don’t have to walk into the center of town to buy what they need. Dolly also provides credit to trusted clients who get paid monthly, such as teachers and nurses.

Dolly is 41 years old, happily married and has two children that are still dependent on her and her husband. She started the business 14 years ago because she enjoys working and wanted to help improve her family’s economic situation. She started the store in the living room of her home with $100 and a table. The store is now stocked with a variety of popular goods that she keeps in display cases and refrigerators. Although she would earn more money if she sold cigarettes or beer, she does not stock these products because she believes they are bad for her community.

A member of the community bank Las Orquideas, Dolly is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would restock some items and buy a new shelf to help organize and display her products. In the future she plans on sending her children to university and buying a copy machine.

loans.use: She would like to buy a new shelf and restock some products

loans.name: Felícita

texts.es:
Felicita is constantly searching for ways to improve her household economy, and facing a difficult situation and a lack of employment, she decided to make her own and used one of her greatest strengths to carry on and gradually overcome that problem. She is very able in the kitchen, and 9 years ago she began to dedicate herself to preparing pancakes and coffee to sell on the corner near her house. Later as her business grew, she decided to offer other dishes as well. Now that her business has grown even more with the sale of fried foods and kebabs, she is very excited, her sales are growing, and she dreams of one day having a restaurant.

Felicita doesn't just dedicate herself to this work, but also to working some small plots of land where she has planted potatoes, which has helped to sustain her family. Her husband works in shipping, and together with Felicita, they support their home's finances every day because they want to make sure their three children have access to a good education and want for nothing, as much as possible. This admirable mother will go on working, but for this kind of opportunity she needs a loan which she will invest in purchasing a grill and some fertilizer for growing potatoes. Support Felicita to go on building a promising future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Felicita esta en una búsqueda constante de mejoras para la economía de su hogar, y ante la difícil situación y la escasez de un empleo decidió crear el suyo y utilizó una de sus mejores habilidades para continuar y superar gradualmente ese problema, ella es muy hábil en la cocina y empezó hace 9 años a dedicarse a preparar café con panqueques para venderlos en una esquina de su casa, luego como iba creciendo su negocio decidió ofrecer además de esto también algunos platillos y ahora a implementado aún más este negocio con la venta de frituras y anticuchos por lo que está muy emocionada debido a que han ido incrementando sus ventas y desea a futuro tener un restaurante.

Felicita no sólo se dedica a estas labores sino que además tiene unos pequeños terrenos en los que ha sembrado papa y esto se ha convertido en un sustento más para los suyos, su esposo trabaja en el transporte y junto a Felicita cada día aporta en la economía de su casa, porque desean que sus tres hijos accedan a una buena educación y en lo posible no les falte nada. Esta admirable madre seguirá trabajando pero para esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo los cuales invertirá en la compra de una parrilla y para la compra de abono para su sembrío de papa. Apoya a Felicita a seguir construyendo un futuro prometedor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase a grill for her restaurant, and some manure for her farming

loans.name: Moata A Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
Luaono P. was selling her taro, bananas, and vegetables by the roadside when a small vehicle pulled up and asked her if there were many ladies like her selling their products by the roadside. She replied that there are a bunch who alternate throughout the week. The driver then introduced herself as SPBD staff and informed her that the organization helps women start up or expand their businesses through a credit and savings scheme. Luaono got excited about the prospects and told her friends and neighbors about SPBD expanding to their village. She lost no time calling up SPBD and scheduled a village meeting with the staff. The village meeting was done a few days before Christmas last year.

Moata village is a farming village just a few kilometers away from the capital town of Salelologa on Savaii Island. A small group of women were so interested that they started their SPBD training early this year. They were taught how to save, prepare simple business plans and budgets, and organize themselves into a village group. They have successfully finished their training and Luaono was elected as the group's president. They have submitted their loan proposals to improve their farms and are awaiting for the disbursement of their loans.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements, agricultural supplies and pay for additional farm help

loans.name: Imma

texts.en: Imma is 42 years old and married with 3 children.  She sells food items in the market of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Before she had access to loans from SMT, Imma used to run her business within their homestead on a very small scale.  With the loans, she has acquired a stall in the market and increased her stock.  She is now requesting a loan of US$ 350 to continue to expand her small business.

loans.use: increase the amount of food items she has for sale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu sells food items in the market of Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With the help of several small loans from SMT, she has diversified her business and can now rent a stall in the market.

Kadiatu is an honest and loyal client of SMT who meets her repayments on time. She is currently requesting a larger loan of US$ 350 to expand her business further. SMT recommends her with pleasure to Kiva for the loan.

Kadiatu is 25 years old and married with 3 children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Kadiatu was successful in the recent expansion of her business and would benefit greatly from additional capital to continue the pattern of growth.

loans.use: to further expand her little market stall

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an energetic young man who is interested in building a poverty-free family. Married with a child, Ibrahim started his business five years ago on a very small scale. He purchases the items he sells on credit from a supplier which increases his costs, leaving him with minimal profit.

With several loans from SMT, Ibrahim began to build his own capital. His capital adequacy is now enough to purchase half of his stock with cash and the other half on credit.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan of US$ 1200. This, he says, will finally free him from purchasing goods on credit which generates less profit. He is happy that this loan will enable him to stop paying his hard earned profits to his creditors.

loans.use: begin purchasing his goods with cash

loans.name: Charles A. B.

texts.en: Charles is a young married man who has one small child.  He primarily sells women's clothing, jewelery, shoes and some perfumes.  With SMT loans, he has diversified his stock, and he is now requesting another loan to expand the business further.

loans.use: additional capital to further develop his business

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is 26 years old and single. He is a school dropout who could not continue with education due to lack of school fees. He started his business with a small amount of capital from his mother and friends and later joined SMT. He has taken small loans 4 times from SMT and has increased his stock.

Alhaji is very hard working and he is anticipating establishing a big shop selling cell phones and their spare parts and other accessories in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1,050.

Alhaji is a young entrepreneur with a sound business idea and plan. He needs additional capital to continue building his business and making it successful.

loans.use: to use as additional capital to expand his small business

loans.name: Sili Centre - Group 1

texts.en: The village of Sili on Savaii Island is one of the well-endowed villages in terms of natural resources.  It has very rich soil, with a large number of springs and creeks which serve as natural irrigation for farms located at the foot of the mountain ranges.  The village learned about SPBD through the radio talk-back shows and from a meeting SPBD staff made with a village chief.  Many women expressed desire to join the microfinance program.  Faamalie's group was the first to undergo the four week SPBD training sessions.  They have successfully prepared their farm plans and budgets, which are the basis of their loan proposals.  Most of the households in Sili village farm taro, bananas and vegetables.  They sell their products in the capital town of Salelologa, which is about 40 kilometers from the village.

loans.use: Purchase of farm implements (bush knives, crowbar, sprayer), agricultural supplies (seeds, seedlings, fertilizers, weed killers) and payment for additional farmhands

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu has been a member of the SMT program for 3 years. With her previous small loans, she expanded her business selling food items. During this period, Isatu developed a good relationship with SMT and built her business capacity. She now feels comfortable and able to expand her business.

Isatu is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 350. Isatu now has the confidence and feels she has the experience to manage a larger loan and help her business get off the ground.

loans.use: to expand her little food stall

loans.name: Satupaitea Pitonuu - Group 1

texts.en: Satupaitea Pitonuu Centre started in December of last year.  The first group of women who joined and were trained with the program are largely from households subsisting on fishing activities.  The husbands and sons fish while the female members of the household sell the catch.  Kirisitina F., the leader of this group, heard about the savings and loans services of SPBD and started motivating ladies in her village to join the program. They aspire to improve their fishing equipment to bring in better catches in the future.  They have undergone the four week training and have submitted their business plans and budgets for their initial loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a wooden canoe for fishing, swimming shoes, goggles, spears and nets

loans.name: La Fuerza, Group 3

texts.en:
Lujida is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in a poverty-stricken community called Los Guaricanos, on the outskirts of the national capital. She has made a small business for herself of selling shoes and clothing from her house, and occasionally along the streets in her community. She is asking for this loan to expand her inventory—specifically she would like to buy a bigger quantity of clothes, as well as a wider variety. With a better variety she can begin to attract new customers, and consequently increase her income.

Her goal is to first grow and expand her business to a new and more profitable level. After that she says she will use her extra income to help give her grandchildren a better and more comfortable life than she has had; she wants to help them grow into smart and good adults.

Lujida says she knows that with God’s help, and this loan, her business will surely grow much stronger. She is very thankful to all of you out there who are helping her by supporting her in this loan!

loans.use: Purchase new varieties of clothing in larger quantity

loans.name: Satupaitea Satufia - Group 1

texts.en: Sipili first discovered the SPBD program.  On her way to the Salelologa market to sell her goods, she saw a lot of women going in and out of a small building near the market.  She inquired about what was going on and she learned about SPBD's microfinance services from some of the ladies in the market who already joined.  When she went home, she told her good friend Mafa about the program, who then started asking women to join the group and get trained.  After four weekly training sessions with SPBD, they were able to prepare business plans and budgets. They are now very excited about the prospects of improving their farms through their first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements, agricultural supplies and pay for additional farm labor

loans.name: La Fuerza, Group 4

texts.en:
Normilia is a 47-year-old woman who lives in a very poor community called Los Guaricanos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She runs a small business of fried foods and breakfast foods. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest money into her business and buy a wider variety of foods to offer her customers in the mornings.

She says her goal is to move her life forward and to live in comfort with a consistent source of income. She would also like to have enough money to afford medicine for her migranes: she often suffers from debilitating headaches, but can’t spare the money to buy medicine to ease the pain.

In her free time she likes to read the Bible, go to her church, and spend time with her family. Normilia is very thankful to everyone who is helping her with his loan—on behalf of her, and our entire team at Esperanza, thank you!

loans.use: Purchase food staples for cooking

loans.name: La Fuerza, Group 5

texts.en:
Elina is a lovely 36-year-old woman who lives with her 5 children and 2 grandchildren in a community called Los Guaricanos on the outskirts of Santo Domingo. She runs a small clothing business where she offers her community members new and used clothing, and everything ranging from pants to shirts to undergarments—as she said “a little bit of everything.” She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of clothing. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits.

Her dreams are to have her own large clothing store one day—but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives.

On behalf of Elina and everyone here at Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase new & used clothing

loans.name: Sili Centre - Group 2

texts.en: After the successful training of the first loan group in Sili village, more women became interested in the SPBD savings and loan program.  The second group of 17 members was organized and trained by SPBD in late January 2008. The village chief has convened the village council, endorsed the SPBD program and encouraged women in the village to join. They are now thinking of putting up a string of stalls by the roadside so that women sell their produce to passersby as an alternative to going to the Salelologa market, which is about 40 kilometers away.  The women hope for the early disbursement of their loan so they can start replanting their farms while the rains are still here.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements, agricultural supplies, and pay for additional farm labor

loans.name: Las Flores, Group 1

texts.en:
Fausta is a 40-year-old woman who lives her two children and husband in the community of Los Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of Santo Domingo. She sells new clothing to her community members, and is asking for this loan so that she can have enough capital to purchase a larger quantity of clothes, have more to offer her clients, and consequently, turn a higher profit each week.

She is an incredibly hard-working woman, someone who has worked since she was only 7 years old! She works hard to improve her business, but also to take care of her children and make sure that they are raised in a safe and healthy home.

When Fausta has a bit of free time she loves to hang out with her children and husband, listen to music, or read Spanish literature.

On behalf of everyone at Esperanza International, and on behalf of Fausta, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Iva Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
The successful training of the first loan group in Iva village sparked a lot of interest in other women in the community.  This group asked members of the first group to help get them acquainted with the SPBD staff who trained them.  Without wasting time, they had their training scheduled.  The women expressed their gratitude for being taught so many things about managing their family income and viewing the farm as a business.
Some of the members went beyond farming to start producing banana and taro chips.  They even opened a food stall to serve the typical Samoan fare of taro, bananas, and vegetables.  The members are now eagerly awaiting for their initial loan so that their business plans can be put into action.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements (bush knives, crowbar, sprayer, rakes), agricultural supplies (taro tubers, seedlings, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides), and pay for additional farm labor

loans.name: Satupaitea Satufia - Group 2

texts.en:
The first SPBD group in the farming village of Satupaitea Satufia created much excitement. More women are eager to join and become part of the centre, which has meetings once a week. They are attracted to the savings and loans services as well as the weekly meeting where each of the members share their successes, failures, and problems from their business and even their families. The group becomes a support mechanism that makes women more confident about their endeavors.

In a short time, a second group of women from the village requested the four session training with SPBD. After attending the very enlightening sessions, they are now ready to take out loans from SPBD. While the businesses are predominantly farming, others have engaged in alternative income-generating activities such as: fine mat weaving, retail shops, elei printing, baking, and fishing.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements, agricultural supplies, and pay for additional farm labor; for those engaged in handicrafts, they will purchase raw materials (reeds, pandanus, paints. fabrics, etc.)

loans.name: Iva Center - Group 3

texts.en:
Group 3 of the Iva Centre is the newest group of women who have joined the program.  More women are joining and enlisting in SPBD's training program since the excitement has spread throughout the village.

Participants learn about savings and loan schemes, business planning, and managing household finances.  Most of them are engaged in farming, but the women are aware of other possibilities.  Some are planning to process their products (for example taro and banana chips) before selling them in the market.  Others are planning to open flea markets where they can sell not only agricultural products but a whole range of other necessary commodities.  The weekly meetings that they attend are very enlightening for all of them.  It is in these meetings that they are able to share ideas and support each other.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements, agricultural supplies and pay for additional farm labor

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a wide-awake, funny, and hard-working old woman who lives in the Los Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo, where she runs a small business. Juana retails a variety of underwear and silver jewelry to women of her community. She says that she still feels young in spite of her age (she’s 55), and wants to keep doing business until she achieves her dream, which is to become one of the most well-positioned suppliers of these goods in her community.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy more products and increase her stock. The entrepreneur has four children that are finishing secondary school and will start university studies very soon.

loans.use: To buy underwear and silver jewelry to increase her stock.

loans.name: Ivelisse Melania

texts.en:
Ivelisse Melania is thirty-seven years old, and she has a son that attends school.  Ivelisse has been selling a collection of pants for a long time in the Alceviejo community of Los Alcarrizos in Santo Domingo, the capital.  The entrepreneur, a very active and passionate woman, operates her business from her house, but she plans on using her loan to rent a small local, as well as purchase new styles of pants and shirts to increase her sales volume and attract new clients.
Ivelisse’s business supports her son’s education, and helps with other family costs.

loans.use: To buy pants and shirts to restock a small business.

loans.name: Yudelkis Altagracia

texts.en:
Yudelkis Altagracia is a thirty-two-year-old single mother of a thirteen-year-old girl. She lives in the Alceviejo community of Los Alcarrizos in Santo Domingo, the capital. Yudelkis sells a collection of chic pants to friends and other people in her community. She doesn’t have a big stock of products, but she makes purchases according to quantity ordered by her customers. Yudelkis says that business is going well, and that she’s getting more and more customers.

Yudelkis wants to stabilize and boost her business. She is requesting a loan to add shirts and underwear to her stock so as to offer more variety to her customers and attract more people.

loans.use: Purchase of an assortment of pants to restock a small business.

loans.name: Salelologa P Centre - Group 1

texts.en: The members of Salelologa P are women who have stalls in the marketplace of the Salelologa village on Savaii Island.  Most of them have been in this kind of business for several years.  The reason they joined the SPBD program is not only to receive loans for their flourishing businesses but also to learn new things about managing their businesses and saving.  Their stalls in the market are near SPBD's office, so it was easy for them to get information about the program when they first started.  Now, they meet every Thursday to discuss their ideas and support each other.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities to sell in their market stalls

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en:
Laurita, a forty-two year old mother of two girls, sells ‘chimichurri’ (a typical Dominican hamburger with lettuce, many kinds of herbs, spices and other condiments). Laurita operates her business from a small local next to her house located in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. The entrepreneur says that this activity is her principal source of income, and she wants to keep carrying on her business “until I become millionaire,” she says, laughing hard.

Laurita hopes that someday she’ll have “a very big store that can compete with Burger King.” With her loan, she’ll buy raw materials to keep preparing her chimichurri.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to prepare hamburgers.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo is a forty-five-year-old woman who is working hard to earn a living and support her five children.  Amparo lives in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal where she sells fresh chicken meat.  Every day, lots of people visit Amparo’s stall to get meat in order to prepare lunch.  Rice with chicken is one of the most popular dishes of the Dominican Republic.  So, the entrepreneur sells a lot, and she has to always be purchasing more and more chickens in the poultry shop.  She is requesting a loan to have sufficient capital to carry on her business.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of chickens to sell retail.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon S. is a 47-year-old fish and vegetable seller in the Preak Kdey Village in Kandal Province; she also takes care of five children, three of whom are students and two of whom are brick kiln laborers. Yon earns about $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Khim Korn, is a motorcycle taxi driver and fisherman. He generally earns about $5 a day.

To increase family income, Yon is requesting a loan of $1100 to enlarge her vegetable business and buy a second-hand fishing boat for her husband’s fishing. This loan will also help to pay for her children’s school fees and daily living expenses.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable business and buy a second-hand fishing boat for her husband's fishing

payments.comment: This is final repayment ealier than original repayment schedule because her business is going wel. She said \" thank you for your laon that help to improve my business\"

loans.name: Solekan

texts.id:
Solekan is a toys seller. He has 2 employees. One of the product that he sells is a candies that are being packaged with toys as gift. One candies package like this cost him IDR 60 thousand (approx of USD 6.6) and he sells this for IDR 100 thousand per package (approx of USD 11). In one day he can sell around 6 to 10 packages.

In a day he can earn a net profit for himself around USD 10.

At the moment Solekan needs additional capital of IDR 7 million (USD 775). This money will be used to add the merchandise as he wants to expand his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Bersama dua orang tenaga kerja yang dimilikinya, Solekan menjalankan usaha Jual Mainan. Salah satu produk yang ia jual adalah permen berhadiah. Satu paket permen dibutuhkan modal sebesar Rp 60.000,00. Sementara dia menjualnya seharga Rp 100.000,00/paketnya. Dalam sehari dia bisa menjual antara 6 -10 paket. Saat ini Solekan mengajukan pinjaman modal sebesar Rp 7.000.000,00. Jumlah tersebut akan digunakan untuk menambah stok barang dagangannya, karena dia ingin mengembangkan usahanya. Asumsinya dia membutuhkan tambahan stok produk mainan lainnya – selain permen berhadiah – sehubungan dengan permintaan langganannya. Secara keseluruhan keuntungan per harinya mencapai Rp 100.000,00.

loans.use: To add merchandise (Menambah stok barang dagangannya)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Budiharjo

texts.id:
Budiharjo is an electrical installation specialist and a contractor. He deals with building construction activities. The number of his employees depends on the size of the project. At the moment he has 6 employees to work on a project. He pays his employees IDR 40,000/ day/person (approx of USD 4.5).

He applied for working capital loan of IDR 6 million (approx of USD 675) to finance one of his project.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai Instalatir Listrik dan Pemborong, Budiharjo melakukan berbagai macam aktivitas yang berkaitan dengan bangunan. Dia mengajukan pinjaman modal senilai Rp 6.000.000,00 untuk mengerjakan suatu proyek. Dalam hal jumlah tenaga kerja sangat bergantung dengan proyek yang ia tangani. Saat ini dia mempekerjakan 6 orang. Satu orang tenaga kerja dia beri upah sebesar Rp 40.000,00/hari.

loans.use: Working capital (Modal usaha)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sunarto

texts.id:
Sunarto is a craftsman, he lives in a rented house with his wife and his two children.

In a month Sunarto can spend IDR 3 million to 3.5 million (approx of USD 330 to USD 385) for salaries of his four employees. He can earn IDR 5 million (approx of USD 525) as revenue for one month. This means he gets a profit of IDR 1.5 million (approx of USD 165) per month.

With the loan money of USD 550 he will be able to add his capital which he can use to buy the handbag material. His customers usually only pay 20% down payment.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam satu bulan Sunarto mengeluarkan dana berkisar antara Rp 3.000.000,00 sampai dengan Rp 3.500.000,00 untuk gaji karyawan, sementara penghasilannya Rp 5.000.000,00. Besar keuntungannya per bulan Rp 1.500.000,00. Nilai tersebut bergantung sekali dengan jumlah pesanan yang ia terima. Saat ini dia bekerja dengan mengandalkan 4 orang karyawannya. Pinjaman modal sebesar Rp 5.000.000,00 akan dia gunakan untuk modal awal, karena tas – tas yang dipesan harus dia selesaikan dengan modalnya sendiri. Pemesan biasanya hanya memberikan uang muka 20% dari harga total. Dia tinggal rumah kontrakan bersama dengan isteri dan dua orang anaknya.

loans.use: to add working capital (Modal awal)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Salelologa E Centre - Group 1

texts.en: Salelologa is the capital village of Savaii Island.  The central market, the wharf, and bus station are located in Salelologa.  The hub of retail business are also in this village.  Therefore, a large number of households are engaged in retail businesses which targets neighboring villages.  The women in this group are engaged in retail businesses.  Most of the commodities sold in Saleloga are purchased from the capital town, Apia, which is located across the island of Upolu. The members of this group have already undergone the required 4 session training from SPBD and are ready to avail their loans to expand and improve their retail businesses.  Some of them engage in other income-generating activities such as: elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of fabric printing), sewing, making pancakes and selling furniture.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities to sell at the retail shop; to make improvements in the store (shelving, painting, roofing); to purchase additional materials for elei printing

loans.name: Salelavalu Uta Centre - Group 1

texts.en: The village of Salelavalu Uta is known for growing fresh vegetables that are sold in the Salelologa market.  Most of the households in Salelavalu Uta are engaged in vegetable gardening. This group of women who have joined the SPBD program want to improve their businesses by building roadside vegetable stalls in front of their houses. The vegetables they produce will be displayed in these stalls so that passersby can easily stop and make purchases.  This is a good alternative to going back and forth to the Salelologa market, which is about 15 kilometers from the village.  The group has undergone training from SPBD and are now ready to avail the loans for their vegetable stalls.

loans.use: to purchase timber, roofing, cement, vegetable seeds, and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Reoung

texts.en: Mrs. Reoung S. M., 46, works making small mills (made of wood or hard stone) at her house. She makes on average around $3 a day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and earns about $2 a day. This couple has eight children, two of who are married and live away from home. Moreover, four others work making small mills, with a revenue of $2 each a day, and the rest of the children are students. To expand the business and produce more mills now they are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase stones to make mills. (Pictured is Mrs. Reoung S. M., on the right, and her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase stones to make mills

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Khob

texts.en: Mrs. Khob S. is a widow and works with her children making small mills (made of wood or hard stone). She sells them door-to-door or sometimes to the market in her village. She normally earns around $3 a day. She has seven children, three of whom are married and live away from home. She aims to get a loan from Kiva to purchase more stones to make mills. (Mrs. Khob S. is pictured with her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase more stones to make mills

loans.name: Hun
