Tania is 21 years old. Tania is a tailor; she makes dress clothing and costumes ordered by established clients. Tania operates her business from her home and also works at a costume shop, where she does embroidery and finishing work.

Ruth is 23 years old. She lives with her partner and 1 year old son. For the past year, Ruth has been running a store where she sells food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar. She buys products in the city of Ayacucho and then sells them in her town.

Clara, Tania, and Ruth need $425, which they will use to buy seeds, fabric, soft drinks, beer, rice, and sugar.

One key aspect of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Clara, Tania, and Ruth plan to use their savings to educate their children, open a women’s clothing shop, and in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to own a tailor shop with industrial sewing machines, own a home, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fabric, soft drinks, beer, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Jorge Martín

texts.es:
Twenty years ago, Jorge Martín worked as a driver in public transportation, first as a minibus driver, then he purchased his own vehicle to start working for himself, despite the inconvenience of having to rent his permit. Little by little, he started to work until he was able to buy his own permit with a more recent car model. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, Jorge has been able to move his family forward.

However, he is currently experiencing difficulty because his source of income (his taxi) no longer offers the comfort and features his customers require. For this reason, he his requesting a loan of $300.00 USD, which he is willing to repay in 3 monthly installments, in order to repair his taxi and offer more safety. With your help, Jorge will be able to move his family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ya 20 años que Jorge Martín trabaja como chofer de transporte público, primero empezó como chofer de un microbús de ruta fija y posteriormente compró su propio vehículo para empezar a trabajar por su cuenta, aunque con el inconveniente de que tenía que rentar las placas, y poco a poco comenzó a trabajar hasta que pudo comprar su propia concesión y con un carro de modelo mas reciente. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, es que Jorge ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Sin embargo actualmente cuenta con una dificultad puesto que su fuente de ingresos (su taxi) ya no cuenta con las comodidades y con los servicios que sus clientes requieren. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Jorge podrá reparar su taxi y así poder ofrecerle un servicio con mayor seguridad. Con tu ayuda Jorge podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Repair his taxi

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is a 27 year old single parent.  With her previous loans, she rented an open space/veranda where she sells her goods.   The business is too small for her to rent a shop in the town.  As a single parent, she is solely responsible for the children’s expenses.  Isatu is very hardworking and determined to provide her children with the best life.  Isatu is requesting a loan of $700 to expand her business and, in the future, rent a shop.

loans.use: Isatu is a hard-working, young entrepreneur who needs some additional capital to help her grow her business and achieve the profits she needs.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is from the community of Rumichaca, which is located 15 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. She has been a member of the community bank Rumichaca for six months. One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Paula plans to use her savings to buy a milk cow. Her dream is to have a large well stocked store and to raise animals like she did before.

Paula is 58 years old. She is a widow and has ten children, only one of whom lives with her. Paula has a store located in her home, where she sells food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar. Paula and her son work together to grow cilantro, carrots, and parsley, which they sell in the market in Ayacucho.

In addition, Paula has four hectares of land, where she harvests wild fruit such as tuna, cochinilla, and tara. In the past, Paula raised animals; she hopes to start this business again soon.

Paula needs a loan of $525, which she will use to buy sugar, milk, oil, rice, a cow and a bull.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, oil, rice, a cow and a bull

loans.name: Nabie

texts.en: Nabie is 37 years old and married with 2 children.  He sells plastic sandals in Makeni town.  Nabie used to sell the sandals in the open air market, but with the previous loans from SMT, he rented a shop for the business.  He is now requesting more loans to increase his stock.

loans.use: Nabie sells shoes and needs a loan to purchase additional stock of the latest styles to continue to attract more customers.

loans.name: Carlos Luciano

texts.es:
Aside from working as a messenger, Carlos decided to take up another job so that he could support his children, who are 8, 5, and 2 years old. In June of 1992, he talked to his dad about his idea of having a taxicab, and he supported him. Little by little, he started his business, later realizing that this job was the best way to earn income for his family. At present, he works in this field.

However, his vehicle needs some repairs in order to offer his customers more safety, which is way he is requesting $300.00 USD to be repaid in 6 monthly installments. With this loan, Carlos will be able to get his cab fixed so that he can continue to work. With your help, Carlos will able to move his children forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

A parte de trabajar como mensajero, Carlos, decidió comenzar a realizar otra actividad para poder sacar dinero para pagar los gastos de sus hijos que actualmente tienen 8, 5 y 2 años. En Junio de 1992 le platicó a su papá de la idea que traía, de tener un carro de ruta y fue así como lo apoyó. Poco a poco comenzó con este negocio y después se dio cuenta que así era la mejor manera de obtener ingresos para su familia. Y actualmente se dedica a este oficio.

Sin embargo la unidad con la que cuenta necesita que se le hagan unos arreglos para poder brindarles más seguridad a sus clientes. Es por eso que Carlos está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Carlos podrá arreglar su carro para poder seguir trabajando en esto. Con tu ayuda Carlos podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Repair his taxicab

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata is 48 years old married with 5 children. 2 of her children are under 18 years old. She is a subsistence farmer in the village of Sulemania, in the Koinadugu district.

She grows vegetables throughout the year. She has a water well in the middle of the farm where she gets water for watering the vegetables. She grows cabbages, green leafy lettuce, onions, tomatoes and hot peppers. With her previous loan from SMT, she began growing irish potatoes and paid back her loan from other farming produce. Isata also grows pigeon peas and some rice. With all the farm activities, she needs to work hard from sun rise to sun set.

She thinks that, if she can access a loan of $1200, she could hire laborers and purchase fertilizer and more vegetable seeds to increase her production for better profits.

loans.use: Isata has an opportunity to grow her farming operation and needs to hire laborers to help her run it.  A loan from Kiva would greatly help her in this endeavor.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs. Felipa P. is from Bluefields city. She is 65 years old and a single mother of 5 adult children. Mrs. P. is the owner of "The Fabiana Kitchen". She has 35 years experience and her customers are mainly walking salesmen. They like her place because she offers a variety of dishes. Right now she needs to buy merchandise for her restaurant. The purchases will include: sacks of rice, nuts and sugar, a drum of olive oil, a dozen concentrated milk cartons, 2 bags of coffee, 1 gallon of ketchup, and 1 box of soft drinks. With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to invest in her kitchen and meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Felipa P. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 65 años de edad es madre soltera de 5 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. P. es propietaria del Comedor Fabiana, tiene 35 años de experiencia sus clientes son vendedores ambulantes que la prefieren por ofrecer comida variada, en estos momentos necesita compra 1quintal de arroz a $ 38.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintal de azúcar a $ 27.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidón de aceite a $ 31.00 dólares el bidón, 1/2 quintal de frijoles a $ 40.00 dólares el 1/2 quintal, 1 docena de leche en polvo a $ 28.00 dólares la docena, 2 bolsas de café a $12.00 dólares cada bolsa, 1 galón de salsa de tomate a $ 6.00 dólares el galón y 1 caja de gaseosa a $ 6.00 dólares la caja, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of food merchandise

payments.comment: El pago real es de $33.33 dólares.
La couta real es de US$ 33.33
La cuota real de pago es de $ 33.33 dólares.
El pago real es de US$33.33

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta M. is 30 years old and married with two kids.  She lives on a farm and their livelihood depends on farming.  She grows cabbage, peppers, pigeon peas and rice.  With her previous loan, Fanta hired laborers and purchased seeds.  She also has other sources of income from micro-businesses in the village.  She sells essential items such as boxes of matches, salt, Maggie, etc., but her main income comes from farming.  She appreciates the previous loan from SMT that increased her production by 30%.  She is now requesting a loan of $525 for labor and for purchasing fertilizer.

loans.use: Fanta needs some farm inputs as well as help harvesting and tending to her crops.  She would benefit from a loan from Kiva so that she could purchase what she needs to have a fruitful crop and hire laborers to assist her in her success.

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
Since she was very young, San Juana has been dedicated to sales, to start with she sold shoes from a catalogue and other goods. Nevertheless, once a friend invited her to a demonstration of kitchen utensils, she fell in love with the products and decided to start selling them. Little by little her products became popular.

Presently she does not have much merchandise and therefore she is requesting a loan of $675 to be repaid in 6 months and with this money, San Juana will buy merchandise to offer more variety to her clients. With your support, San Juana will be able to provide properly for her youngest daughter who is the only child living at home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que era muy joven San Juana se dedica a las ventas, en un inicio vendía zapatos por catálogo y otros artículos. Sin embargo en una ocasión una amiga de ella la invitó a una demostración de artículos de cocina, quedó encantada con los productos y decidió comenzar a venderlos. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer por los productos que vende.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con mucha mercancía es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $675 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero San Juana podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes y que estos tengan de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda San Juana podrá sacar adelante a su hija la más chica que es la única que vive en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales of kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ma. Sebastiana

texts.es:
Ma. Sebastiana has three sons, one is married, another is working, and the youngest is studying a degree. It has not been easy, though, to get this far. When her sons were younger they only lived on her husband’s income. Nevertheless, growing up, expenses increased and therefore in 1993 they started a blacksmith shop with a welding machine and a polishing machine and little by little they started to offer blacksmith service. Later the business began growing and they hired two employees due to the amount of work.

Presently, however, their business requires new tools and therefore Ma. Sebastiana is requesting a loan of $675 to be repaid in 6 months and with the money Ma. Sebastiana will buy material and tools to offer a better service to their clients. With your support Ma. Sebastiana will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Ma. Sebastiana tiene tres hijos, de los cuales uno está casado, otro ya trabaja y el más chico está estudiando una carrera. Sin embargo llegar hasta este punto no fue fácil. Puesto cuando sus hijos eran pequeños sólo vivían con lo que ganaba su esposo. Sin embargo al ir creciendo los gastos incrementaron y fue por eso que en 1993, comenzaron con un negocio de herrería con una máquina de soldar y una pulidora, y así poco a poco comenzaron a ofrecer los servicios de herrería. Después el negocio comenzó a crecer y contrataron dos empleados gracias a la cantidad de trabajo.

Sin embargo actualmente su negocio está requiriendo de nueva herramienta ya que con la que cuentan ya no les es suficiente. Es por eso que Ma. Sebastiana está solicitando un crédito de US $675 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ma. Sebastiana podrá comprar materiales y herramienta para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Con tu ayuda Ma. Sebastiana podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase material and tools for a blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Unfortunately Paula became a widow and responsible for her son whom she always wishes to give the best. Due to lack of money Paula started to prepare food which she sold to her neighbors. Little by little her business grew and presently she has a stand at the markets and at her house.

Nevertheless, the market place does not have good facilities that allow for providing shadow. Therefore she is requesting a loan of $750 to be repaid in 6 months and with that money, Paula will buy a metal structure which she can set up on Sundays at a market place. With your support Paula will get ahead and be able to provide her son with a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Desafortunadamente Paula enviudó y se quedó a cargo de su hijo al cuál desea darle siempre lo mejor. Por la falta de dinero fue por lo que Paula comenzó a elaborar comidas para vender a sus vecinos. Poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio actualmente tiene un puesto en los mercados y en su casa.

Sin embargo en el mercado no cuenta con una buena instalación que le tape el sol. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Paula podrá comprar una estructura de metal para que pueda instalarse los domingos en un mercado. Con tu ayuda Paula podrá salir adelante y ayudar a que su hijo estudie una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase a metal structure to improve a stall.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María’s husband moved from Ciudad de Victoria to work, and therefore the money he sent occasionally took long to reach Luz and the daily expenses could not be covered. For that reason she began to sell second-hand electronic devices to obtain earnings that would allow her to pay the daily expenses of her three children, 16, 13, and 6 years of age.

Presently Luz is requesting a loan of $950 to be repaid in 6 months, and with this money Luz will buy merchandise, as clients looking for new items occasionally leave without. Therefore she needs more variety so her clientele always can find something new. With your support Luz will be able to keep her business going and also support her children to study a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Luz María, salió de la Ciudad de Victoria a trabajar. Es por eso que en ocasiones el dinero tardaba mucho tiempo en que llegara a manos de Luz, y los gastos diarios no podían ser cubiertos. Fue así que comenzó a vender aparatos electrónicos usados, para poder tener una ganancia que le permitiera pagar los gastos diarios de sus tres hijos de 16, 13 y 6 años.

Actualmente Luz está solicitando un crédito de US $950 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Luz podrá comprar mercancía, puesto que en ocasiones llegan clientes a buscar cosas nuevas y se van sin nada. Es por eso que necesita tener más variedad para que sus clientes siempre encuentren algo nuevo. Con tu ayuda Luz logrará sacar su negocio adelante, además de ayudar a que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales of electronics.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa C. V.’s business is located in the district of San Rafael, province of Bellavista, Department of San Martín. For a living she has been manufacturing and selling cheese for the past year and a half, and the production is between 30 and 35 pieces daily.

With the loan of S/.2,000.00 ($700) to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a new refrigerator as the one she owns is not in good condition and this kind of equipment is very important in her line of business to preserve the cheese. Rosa is 42 years old and has two children. She learned to manufacture cheese from her parents when she was very young and has now put learning into practice. Her future plans are to adapt premises for the exclusive production of these products as she is now doing it at home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa C. V. tiene su negocio ubicado en el distrito de San Rafael, provincia de Bellavista, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la elaboración casera y venta de quesos, es un negocio que inicio desde hace un año y medio diariamente producen entre de 30 a 35 quesos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 el cual pagara en 6 meses, comprara una nueva refrigeradora, ya que la que tiene actualmente no esta en muy buenas condiciones, ya que este es un equipo muy importante en su negocio para la buena conservación de los quesos. Rosa tiene 42 años y 02 hijos, aprendió a elaborar quesos desde muy pequeña junto a sus padres, ahora esta poniendo en practica lo aprendido, tiene como aspiración hasta el próximo año implementar un local para la elaboración exclusiva de estos productos ya que por ahora lo esta realizando en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator to preserve the production of cheese.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virgina L. D. D. is a member of the Comunal Bank "Flor D. mani". She is originally from the County of San Martin, in the district of Soritor, in the province of Moyobamba. She makes and sells bricks, and she has her own brick shop at the border of the Soritor district, where she attends to her clients who wait for her bricks. She is happy as, thanks to this business, she can support her family. She is a widow, and as such has had to manage the business, somthing new for her as her husband did all of this before.

With the loan of $2000 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will invest in large quantities of firewood, as well as fuel for the motor that is used to make the bricks, and some calamine in order to expand the sheds where the bricks dry, so that she can meet the demand she receives.

She is 45 years old and has two daughters who are studying. They help out in the house and give her the strength to keep working. Virginia is happy with what she has achieved to date; this business allows her to mix with many people such as the authorities from the energy and mineral sectors. She is also a part of the Soritor Brick-Makers Association, all of which gives her more self-esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Virginia López D. D., es socia del Banco Comunal “ Flor del Maní” ella es natural D. la provincia D. Moyobamba, distrito D. Soritor, departamento D. San Martín, se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. ladrillos, cuenta con su propia ladrillera a la entrada del distrito D. Soritor a donD. asisten sus espera sus clientes para la compra D. los ladrillos, esta contenta por que gracias a su actividad pueD. sacar a su familia adelante, al quedar viuda ella tuvo que dirigir el negocio, actividad que era nuevo para ella, ya que su esposo era quien administraba el negocio. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2 000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertira en la compra D. leña en grandes cantidades, además combustible para su motor con el cual fabrican los ladrillos y calaminas para aumentar sus galpones en donD. secan los ladrillos, para así poder abastecer los pedidos que tiene, Tiene 45 años y tiene 2 hijas que aun están estudiando ellas la apoyan en las actividades D. la casa y le dan fuerzas para seguir trabajando, Virginia esta contenta con los logros obtenidos hasta la fecha, , este negocio le permite relacionarse con muchas personas como autoridades del sector energía y minas, también forma parte D. la Asociación D. Ladrilleras D. Soritor, todo ello mejoro su autoestima.

loans.use: She will invest the loan in buying materials for her business/El prestamo lo invertira en la compra de materiales para su negocio

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos is 31 years old and is a motorbike-taxi driver in urban areas. He also has a small business selling beers and fizzy drinks from his house.

He now lives in his won house in the Chane Justiniano community, 3km from Montero, with his wife and kids.

Juan Carlos has worked in transport for many years, and is part of the Econada Association, as well as selling drinks. His experience means that he has a lot of frequent clients.

The competition in both areas of his work is average. He would like a loan in order to pay for an operation on his son's left arm, as he had an accident and fractured it. His credit history is good, and to date he has not had loans with any other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juan Carlos tiene 31 años de edad y en transportista público urbano de pasajeros con su moto taxi también tiene su pequeña venta de cervezas y gaseosas en su casa. Actualmente vive en una casa que es propia y que se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Chane Justiniano a 3 Km. de Montero, junto a su esposa e hijos. Juan Carlos trabaja en el rubro del transporte hace varios años atrás, formando también parte de la Asociación La Enconada, al igual que con el negocio de las bebidas. Su antiguedad es uno de los factores que le permiten tener clientela frecuentemente. La competencia en ambas actividades es mediana. La presente solicitud será para la aumentar para la operación del brazo ixquierdo de su hijo, que sufrió un accidente y se fracturó. Sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos y a la fecha no reporta crédiots en otras instituciones financieras.

loans.use: To pay for an operation/complemento para operación

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa C. V. is a member of the “San Rafael” microfinance institute. Her business is located in the district of San Rafael, Bellavista province, in the department of San Martín. She has been selling homemade cheese for a living for a year and a half. She produces between 30 to 35 cheeses a day.

With the loan of S/. 2,000.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a new refrigerator, since the one she currently has is no longer in good condition. This piece of equipment is vital to her business for the proper storage of her cheese.

Rosa is 42 years of age and has 2 children. She learned cheesemaking at a young age from her parents. Now, she is putting her skills to use. Her desire is to set up a business space next year so that she can make her cheese because she is doing it from home for now.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa C. V. es socia del Banco Comunal “San Rafael” tiene su negocio ubicado en el distrito de San Rafael, provincia de Bellavista, departamento de San Martín, ella se dedica a la elaboración casera y venta de quesos, es un negocio que inicio desde hace un año y medio diariamente producen entre de 30 a 35 quesos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 el caul pagara en 6 meses, comprara una nueva refrigeradora, ya que la que tiene actualmente no esta en muy buenas condiciones, ya que este es un equipo muy importante en su negocio para la buena conservación de los quesos.

Rosa tiene 42 años y 02 hijos, aprendió a elaborar quesos desde muy pequeña junto a sus padres, ahora esta poniendo en practica lo aprendido, tiene como aspiración hasta el próximo año implementar un local para la elaboración exclusiva de estos productos ya que por ahora lo esta realizando en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerator

loans.name: Patricia Blanca

texts.es:
Patricia does not have her own house, and she as a nanny in a friend's house. She has an 8 year old daughter and is a single mother.

She works selling 'anticuchos' (a dish made with lamb's heart), and she does this on the Papa Paulo avenue. She goes out to sell it from 7pm-1am. She has been doing this for quite a while and she has many clients; her anticucho is considered to be the best in all of Cochabamba.

She would like a loan to pay off personal debts and also to invest a little in raw ingredients for the anticuchos, mainly to buy the hearts, some potatoe and some carbon every two days. This is Patricia's third loan with our institution and if she has ever been behind in payments it has been for good reason, as she was quite ill and could not go out to sell regularly for a while.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia no tiene una casa propia y vive como cuidadora en la casa de una de sus amistades, tiene sólo una hija de 8 años de edad y es madre soltera. Su negocio de venta de anticuchos (corazon de res) se encuentra ubicado en la esquina de la avenida Papa Paulo y sólo sale a vender por las noches a partir de las 7:00 de la noche hasta la 1:00 de la madrugada, tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio y bastante clientela ya que sus anticuchos son considerados los mejores de todo Cochabamba. La presente solicitud es para pagar unas deudas que tiene con terceras personas y también invertirá un poco en la adquisición de materia prima para los anticuchos, generalmente compra corazón, papa y carbón cada dos días. Esta es la tercera solicitud de Patricia en nuestra Institución y si bien algunas veces presentó algunos retrasos fueron justificados ya que la pasada gestión ella se encontraba delicada de salud y no podía salir a vender regularmente.

loans.use: Tp pay off personal debts/Pago deudas personales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is 41 years old. He is a dentist and his wife makes t-shirts. They have two kids, the eldest is a girl in 6th grade, and the youngest recently enrolled in pre-school. The family live in a house which they bought partially on credit. They are a very united family and their kids are very well behaved.

Armando has a lot of experience in dentistry and in the health care arena, and his wife has been sewing for many years. She does this from home so that she can look after their kids. There is quite high competition for Armando and his surgery is in a very busy shopping zone. However, he has gained many clients, and his wife has also been contracted by schools and institutions to make sports kits.

Armando now has some equipment he needs to buy, such as a dental chair for about $700. He will repay this loan with his wages. They are long-term clients of this institution and this is their third loan with them to date.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Armando es un señor de 41 años de edad de profesión dentista y su esposa es confeccionista de poleras. Ambos tienen dos hijos, la mayor es mujer y cursa el 6to de primaria y el segundo recientemente ingreso a Prekinder. La familia vive en una casa donde tomaron unas piezas en anticretico. Son una familia unida y sus hijos demuestran mucha educacion. Armando tiene muchos años de experiencia en odontologia y en el área de salud, la esposa esta muchos años tambien con el negocio de costura, esta actividad la realiza en su casa lo que le permite estar cuidar de cerca a sus hijos. La competencia de don Armando esta entre media y alta, su consultorio esta ubicado en zona muy comercial. Pero tiene ya ganada una cartera de clientes, la esposa de igual forma es buscada por colegios e instituciones para trabajos de poleras de educacion fisica por ejemplo. Armando presento proforma de equipos que desea comprar, aproximadamente un sillon dental le cuesta 700$us, con el saldo cancelara su crédito vigente en la institución. Son antiguos clientes de la institución, esta es su tercera secuencia, actualmente estan identificados con la institución.

loans.use: To invest in equipment/Inversión en equipamiento

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es:
Maria Celia is 43 years old and has been separated from her husband for a few years now. She lives with her daughter in her sister, Blanca C.'s house. One of her sons is coming back from the barracks soon and her daughter is still in high school.

She has been selling onions for more than 4 years. There is some competition, but her stall is in the main market with all the other onion sellers, so the buyers know exactly where to go.

With this loan, she will buy a sound system for $200 and a table with drawers for $50. She will use her current wages to repay it. Maria has had loans before with financial companies as she took out credit through a group she was in. She has now finished paying off this loan and therefore has the opportunity to get more credit. This will be her third loan, and her credit rating is very good. She is a very good candidate.

Translated from Spansih by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Celia es una señora de 43 años de edad que actualmente está separada de su esposo desde hace varios años atrás. Actualmente vive sólo con su hija en la casa de su hermana que se llama Blanca C.. Uno de sus hijos esta por llegar del cuartel y su hija aún está estudiando en colegio. Tiene una experiencia de más de 4 años en el comercio de cebollas. La competencia es media, su puesto de venta se encuentra en un mercado principal y exactamente en un sector de comercio de cebollas, por lo que las compradoras ya saben donde dirigirse. Con la presente solicitud comprará el equipo de sonido que costara aproximadamente 200$us y la comoda unos 50$us. Con el saldo se cancelara su actual crédito en la institución. Maria tuvo un antecedente en una entidad financiera como consecuencia de un crédito en grupo que sacaron, ella termino de cancelar el crédito. Se le dio la oportunidad en la institución y actualmente esta con su tercer crédito, su promedio de mora es bajisimo, casi cero. Tiene un excelente comportamiento.

loans.use: To buy and use a table with drawers and a sound system/Consumo, compra de comoda y equipo de sonido

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Elena's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Rosa, and Laura have been members of the community bank Juanito for one year. In that time they have learned how to be respectful, punctual, and responsible. In addition, they feel like people have confidence in them, which has improved their self-esteem.

Maria is 35 years old. She is a single mom and has a 14 year old son. Maria has a dressmaking shop. She has worked in other dressmaking shops before, but has only recently been able to open her own shop.

Rosa is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and their two young children. Rosa sells candies and small toys.

Laura is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and their 2 year old child. Laura owns an Internet café. She was able to open the business one and a half years ago.

Maria, Rosa, and Laura need a loan of $925, which they will use to buy materials, candy, chocolate, gum, web cams, and computer products.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Maria, Rosa, and Laura plan to use their savings to expand their businesses, pay for an engagement, and to open a second business.

loans.use: To buy materials, candy, chocolate, gum, web cams, and computer products

loans.name: Elisabeth Saida's Group

texts.en:
Elisabeth, Dionesia, and Elisa are members of the community bank Rumichaka. They have all been members for less than one year. All of the women live in the rural area outside Ayacucho. In that time they have learned to be punctual and responsible, as well as the importance of saving.

Elisabeth is 41 years old, married and has four children. She has several fields where she grows vegetables that she later sells in Ayacuhco.

Dionesia is 36 years old, married and has six children. Like Elisabeth, Dionesia grows vegetables. She sells them to an intermediary who sells them in Ayacucho. Dionesia would eventually like to buy a car so that she can transport her vegetables herself.

Elisa is 22 years old. She lives with her partner and their two children. Elisa also has a field where she grows vegetables. In addition, Elisa grows flowers and raises guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru.

Elisabeth, Dionesia, and Elisa need a loan of $775, which they will use to buy seeds, a car, and animal feed.

Their dreams are to continue improving themselves and their businesses, and that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, a car, and animal feed

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en:
Dina, Neomi, and Rosa have been members of the community bank Manantial for less than one year. They were invited to join the bank by friends and colleagues. Through the community bank they have learned responsibility, the importance of saving, money management, and solidarity.

Dina is a 25 year old student studying elementary education at the local university. She sells cosmetics and other beauty products on order to help pay for school. She uses catalogues from companies such as Avon to take orders for her friends and family.

Neomi is 42 years old, married and has three children. Neomi joined the bank in order to take advantage of the interest earning savings account. She takes out small loans in order to help other family members.

Rosa is 22 years old, married and has one young child. She is studying elementary education. In order to help pay for school, Rosa works with a friend selling soft drinks and beer. She does not like this business, and with her loan she will open a store selling clothing.

Dina, Neomi, and Rosa need $675, which they will use to buy beauty products, support a family member, and start selling clothing.

Their dreams are to finish school, find good jobs, and build a house.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, support a family member, and start selling clothing

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga has been a member of the community bank “Tulipanes” for 12 years. She was invited to join the bank by a neighbor and has been an active member ever since. Since joining the bank, she has learned how to take care of her children and to work in solidarity.

Olga is forty years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of three and 21 years old. Olga said she almost withdrew from the bank several times but each time the employees worked with her personally to solve her problems. Olga has owned a small grocery store where she also sold set meals for five years.

Olga needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to start selling small toys and games at her store.

Olga’s dream is that her children will be able to finish school and become professionals.

loans.use: Olga needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to start selling small toys and games at her store.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. She joined the community bank because the whole process to obtain loans and funding is easier and takes less time. Through the community bank, she has learned marketing, health improvement, and development of healthy family relationships.

Florinda works as an accountant in the mornings, and in the afternoons she runs a store out of her home. She sells mainly food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar.

Florinda needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more merchandise for her store.

Her dream is to own her home and her business, which are now rented.

loans.use: Florinda needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marinee's Group

texts.en:
Marinee and Nery are members of the community bank “Buena Suerte”. Marinee has been an associate of the community bank for ten years, while Nery has been a member for a little over one year. Through the bank they have learned responsibility and punctuality.

Marinee is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and their one child. Marinee used to be a bank organizer with the community bank, but now concentrates on her business. She has two businesses. Marinee travels to Lima and buys clothing that she later sells to distributors in Ayacucho. Marinee also sells used cars.

Nery is 33 years old. She is separated and has two children. One time per week Nery travels to the city of Tambo, which is two and a half hours outside of Ayacucho, to buy grains. She later sells the grains at the market in Ayacucho.

Marinee and Nery need loans of 1000 and 900 sole (3 soles = $1), which they will use to improve their home, and to buy wheat, corn, barley, and other grains.

loans.use: Marinee and Nery need loans of 1000 and 900 sole (3 soles = $1), which they will use to improve their home, and to buy wheat, corn, barley, and other grains.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi L., 54 years old, currently live with her husband and two kids at Y Yen Disctric of Nam Dinh Province. Outside of farming, her other primary job is breeding pigs. Before joining the TYM group, her family's income was unstable and they encountered many difficulties, mainly due to the lack of capital to invest and expand their business. After joining the group, Mrs. L. has take out loan to just focus on breeding pigs. She now have about 10 healthy pigs and her own income has reached 100 USD per month. In addition to that, her two childrens are working as building workers to help out their mother in weekly payment. Mrs. L. just recently renew her pond and get into raising fishes. She currently need to take out a loan of 450 USD to buy more piglets and breeding fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Lụa, 54 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Ngoài làm ruộng công việc chủ yếu của chị Lụa là chăn nuôi lợn. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình có nhiều khó khăn, chủ yếu do ít vốn đầu tư nên thu nhập cũng thấp. Sau khi vào Quỹ chị Lụa vay vốn tập trung chăn nuôi lợn. Đàn lợn của chị lúc nào cũng trên dưới 10 con béo tốt, khoẻ mạnh. Thu nhập riêng từ chăn nuôi bình quân hàng tháng đạt 100USD. Ngoài ra 2 con chị cũng đi làm thợ xây hỗ trợ mẹ trong việc trả tiền tuần. Chị Lụa vừa sửa sang lại ao để thả cá tăng thêm thu nhập. Chị đang muốn vay 450USD để mua lợn con và cá giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs and fishes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi Lua, 54 years old, currently live with her husband and two kids at Y Yen Disctric of Nam Dinh Province. Outside of farming, her other primary job is breeding pigs. Before joining the TYM group, her family's income was unstable and they encountered many difficulties, mainly due to the lack of capital to invest and expand their business. After joining the group, Mrs. Lua has take out loan to just focus on breeding pigs. She now have about 10 healthy pigs and her own income has reached 100 USD per month. In addition to that, her two childrens are working as building workers to help out their mother in weekly payment. Mrs. Lua just recently renew her pond and get into raising fishes. She currently need to take out a loan of 450 USD to buy more piglets and breeding fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu, 52 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 16 tuổi tại Yên Khang, ý Yên. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1997. Trong các năm tham gia Quỹ chị đều vay vốn ở mức tối đa sử dụng vào việc buôn bán than. Nơi chị sống là vùng ven bến sông thuận lợi cho việc buôn bán hàng hoá theo đường thủy. Hàng chị bán phục vụ cho nhân dân trong vùng và một số cở sở đốt gạch. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng mang lại cho gia đình một khoản thu nhập tương đối. Trung bình mỗi tháng gia đình chị Sáu thu 250USD. Than đang bán chạy nên chị Sáu vừa làm đơn xin vay 1200USD để tăng số lượng than xuất nhập.

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 33 years old, is currently living with her husband and two children at Y Yen District of Nam Dinh Province. Both of her children are still in school right now. In 2000 when her family had some financial difficulties, she tried to request for loan to breed pigs and poultry. Between the options of the Bank, a Credit Agency or TYM, she had chosen TYM because its refunding policy really suit her (and many other women) form of small business. Just as she thought, after 7 years being a part of TYM, her family's income has increased substantially. They had been able to purchased a TV, a motorbicycle and a few other households appliances. This year, as the price of cattle-feed is rising, Mrs. D. would like to take another loan of 775 USD to buy these foods and renew her breeding facility.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị D., 33 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Hai con chị D. hiện đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước năm 2000 kinh tế gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn chị D. có nhu cầu vay vốn về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Trên địa bàn lúc đó có các nguồn vốn của Ngân hàng, Quỹ tín dụng nhân dân và Quỹ Tình thương. Sau khi suy nghĩ, chị D. quyết định chọn vay vốn từ Quỹ Tình thương vì cách thức hoàn trả ở đây rất phù hợp với chị em phụ nữ làm kinh tế nhỏ. Đúng như chị lựa chọn, sau 7 năm tham gia, kinh tế gia đình đã nâng lên rõ rệt. Gia đình chị đã sắm được tivi, xe máy và một số vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình. Năm nay do giá thức ăn gia súc, gia cầm tăng cao chị D. muốn vay thêm 775USD để đầu tư mua thức ăn và sửa sang chuồng trại.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, chickens and repair breeding facilities

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị B., 48 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1998. In first few years, she took out loans to invest in her herd of pigs. The weekly repayments were handled by her husband’s wages. Recently, her husband’s health is bad and getting worse. The repayments become burdens and she has to sew gloves for extra income. Her two children are still in school that’s why she insists to work harder for their future. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 775USD to buy material for glove making and young chickens. She lives in Ý Yên, Nam Định.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị B., 48 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Các năm đầu vốn vay được chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào việc chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi cũng khá, đủ để gia đình có một cuộc sống ổn định. Khoản tiền trả tuần thường do chồng chị B. đi làm hỗ trợ. Những năm trở lại đây sức khoẻ anh Tiến, chồng chị không còn được tốt, hoàn trả tuần đôi lúc khó khăn. Chị B. chủ động tìm thêm nghề phụ là may găng tay. Công việc này vừa giúp chị có tiền trả tuần vừa bảo đảm thu nhập thường xuyên. Hai con còn đang đi học nên chị B. xác định còn phải vất vả thêm vài năm nữa. Vòng vốn này chị muốn vay thêm 775USD để mua vải may găng tay và mua gà con. Hiện chị B. đang sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy clothes to make gloves and buy chickens

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Thank you very much for the first loan that I obtained through you. It was very useful, and by business has grown as a result. I want to remodel my store and improve it for the summer season so that the merchandise will be in a better condition, and my clients will be feeling more comfortable when they come to buy. I am requesting a loan of $1200 to remodel and improve my business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Gracias por el primer préstamo que obtuve con ustedes fue de gran ayuda para mi negocio a crecido mucho. Quiero remodelar el negocio y acondicionarlo para esta temporada de calor y así la mercancía estará en mejor estada y mis clientes estarán más cómodos cuando venga a comprar su mercancía. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para remodelar y acondicionar el negocio.

loans.use: To remodel and improve her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. NguY. Thi Y., 32 years old, joined the Fund since 1998. Her family has 4 members: the parents and two children. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family encountered lots of difficulties because she did not own much rice field. She could earn enough food for the family after harvesting. However, being very active, Mrs. Y. borrowed money from the Fund to make rice vermicelli. Her income was stable, giving her opportunity to repay weekly. Yet, her family economy did not improve very fast. Realizing that many families in the area breed chickens and pigs, she switched to selling cattle and poultry food. So far, her family income is 200-250 USD/month. Being confident at the improvement of her plan, this time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more cattle and poultry food to sell, increasing the income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Yến, 32 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 4 người, 2 vợ chồng và 2 con. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ, kinh tế gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn do ruộng ít, mỗi vụ thu hoạch chỉ đủ ăn. Vốn là người năng động, chị Yến tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn về làm bún. Thu nhập ổn định lại thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả tuần nhưng kinh tế phát triển chậm. Nhận thấy nhiều gia đình trong vùng chăn nuôi lợn gà, chị chuyển sang đầu tư vào buôn bán thức ăn gia súc và gia cầm. Đến nay thu nhập gia đình chị Yến đạt từ 200 đến 250USD/tháng. Tự tin trước sự phát triển của dự án, vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD mua thức ăn gia súc để tăng thêm thu nhập

loans.use: Buy cattle and poultry food to sell.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi S.,40 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1998. She is living in Y Yen, Nam Dinh with her husband and 2 children. During the recent years, she used her borrowed money mainly on breeding pigs and chickens. Besides, she also collected wasted material to be able to repay weekly. Her family economy experienced some changes. Currently, Mrs. S. is doing business on wasted material at home so that she does not have to move around and it is also convenient for taking care of the animals. Her average income from selling and buying wasted material is 3-4 USD/day. Besides, every farrow of pigs bring her several hundred USD. This time she wants to borrow 525 USD to use for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Sửu, 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Chị sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định cùng chồng và 2 con. Trong các năm qua, chị Sửu vay vốn sử dụng chủ yếu cho mục đích chăn nuôi lợn gà. Bên cạnh đó để có tiền trả tuần, chị đi thu mua phế liệu. Kinh tế gia đình cũng có nhiều chuyển biến. Hiện nay, chị Sửu chuyển sang thu mua phế liệu tại nhà, vừa đỡ đi lại vất vả, vừa tiện cho việc chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân một ngày từ việc buôn bán phế liệu khoảng 3-4USD. Ngoài ra mỗi lứa lợn bán mang về cho chị vài trăm USD. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 525USD để sử dụng cho việc buôn bán.

loans.use: Buy wasted materials

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi M., 58 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1999. During 8 years of participation, she used her borrowed money on breeding the chickens and pigs. She always has around 10 pigs in the pigsty. Her big backyard is used for breeding chickens and ducks. She sells eggs from chickens and ducks to earn money to repay weekly. Besides, she also gets help from her 2 children who are working now. Her average income increases year by year. Now, her monthly income is 200-220 USD/month. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more pigs. She is living with her husband and her youngest children in Yen Tri, Y Yen, Nam Dinh.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị M., 58 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1999. Trong 8 năm tham gia, chị M. vay vốn sử dụng chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi lợn gà. Đàn lợn nhà chị M. luôn có trên dưới một chục con. Khoảng sân rộng sau nhà được chị M. tận dụng cho việc nuôi gà, vịt. Trứng gà, trứng vịt có thể bán lấy tiền trả tuần, bên cạnh đó là sự hỗ trợ của 2 con đã đi làm. Thu nhập tăng lên qua các năm, đến nay mỗi tháng bình quân gia đình chị M. thu khoảng 200-220USD. Vòng vốn này chị M. xin vay 950USD để mua lợn con về chăn nuôi. Chị M. hiện sống cùng chồng và người con út tại xã Yên Trị, ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T., 40 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1998. Her husband passed away 8 years ago from a fatal disease. She was on her own to raise her 2 children. Now, her oldest child is 20 years old and the other one is 17 years old. During difficult time, TYM Fund was a great help to her. Besides being able to borrow money, every time she is ill, she always gets help from the branch and other members. Before, she used the borrowed money on breeding pigs and chickens pretty effectively. Her average income is 150 USD/month. Recently, she has been investing in breeding cows and this activity brings her a higher income. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more cows and she will sell them when the price is high enough.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Thân, 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Chồng chị qua đời từ 8 năm trước sau một cơn bệnh hiểm nghèo. Một mình chị bươn chải nuôi 2 con, đến nay cháu đầu 20, cháu sau 17 tuổi. Trong lúc khó khăn, Quỹ Tình thương đã trở thành chỗ dựa cho chị Thân. Không những được vay vốn làm ăn, những lúc ốm đau chị đều được chi nhánh và những chị em trong cụm hỗ trợ. Các vòng vốn trước chị vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn gà mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế tương đối. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Thân là 150USD. Những vòng vốn gần đây chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò và thấy việc này mang lại thu nhập cao. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 950USD để mua bò và sẽ bán khi được giá.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Vu Thi C., 36 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva's partner) since 2007.  Her husband is a farmer.  Her three children are all going to school, so her family encounters a lot of difficulties.  To increase income, besides farming, Mrs. C. also make and sell gloves.  It has become her main job.  Each day she makes 6-7 pairs of gloves, each pair is $1.  Deducting costs, each month she gets 130USD.  She uses her own money and the loan to pay for the cost of goods sold. After the first loan was used efficiently, this time he wants to borrow 450USD to buy more materials to make gloves.  She hopes her income this year would be more than that last year.  Mrs. C. now lives in Y Yen, Nam Dinh province.

 Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.  

Chị Vũ Thị Chúc, 36 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007. Chồng chị là một nông dân, 3 con đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học nên kinh tế gia đình có nhiều khó khăn. Để có thêm thu nhập, ngoài làm ruộng chị Chúc may găng tay bán. Đây trở thành công việc chính của chị. Mỗi ngày chị Chúc may được 6-7 đôi găng, mỗi đôi có giá khoảng 1USD. Trừ chi phí, mỗi tháng chị Chúc thu khoảng 130USD. Tiền mua vải nguyên liệu bao gồm vốn tự có của gia đình và nguồn vay từ Quỹ. Sau năm đầu vay vốn sử dụng hiệu quả, vòng thứ 2 này chị Chúc xin vay 450USD để tiếp tục đầu tư mua thêm vải. Chị hi vọng thu nhập trong năm nay sẽ tăng cao hơn năm ngoái. Chị Chúc hiện đang sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy clothes to make gloves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 46 years old, is a long-term member of the TYM Fund in Phuc Yen. Even though other members decided to do businesses near the town center, Mrs. T. chose to breed animals and sell food in the market. Her breeding complex has different sections for pigs, ducks and chickens, and rabbits. Currently, she has 6 pigs ready to be released, several hundred chickens and ducks laying eggs every day, and rabbits that are pregnant. Her income is pretty high and stable. She is not only good at doing business but also is an exemplary social person. Her father-in-law is a veteran. Her husband is working for the aerial authority and is very encourageous about the TYM Fund. Her oldest child graduated from University and is having a good job. Her youngest child is a senior in Hanoi Polytechnic University. She said she joined the Fund to improve her family economy, and also to participate in the Women’s activities in the area. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more animal food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, 46 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên lâu năm của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh Phúc Yên. Khác các thành viên trong cụm thường làm dự án kinh doanh buôn bán, dịch vụ, tận dụng lợi thế gần trung tâm Thị xã chị Tuyết chọn dự án chăn nuôi kết hợp đi chợ buôn bán. Cơ ngơi chuồng trại của chị khá quy mô với nhiều khu riêng như: Khu chăn nuôi lợn, khu chăn nuôi ngan gà và khu chuồng trại nuôi thỏ. Hiện tại chị có khoảng hơn 6 tạ lợn thịt sắp xuất chuồng, khoảng hơn trăm gà đẻ và ngan cho trứng hàng ngày và vài chục cặp thỏ sinh sản. Thu nhập của chị tương đối cao và rất ổn định. Không chỉ giỏi làm kinh tế, gia đình chị Tuyết còn là một trong những gia đình văn hoá điển hình của phường. Bố chồng chị công tác trong quân đội về hưu, chồng chị đang công tác tại phường rất hiểu về Quỹ và rất ủng hộ chị. Con trai lớn đã tốt nghiệp đại học và đã có việc làm ổn định, con trai út đang học năm cuối trường đại học Bách khoa Hà Nội. Tâm sự của chị Tuyết là tham gia Quỹ ngoài việc vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế, còn góp phần xây dựng phong trào phụ nữ địa phương. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, chickens

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Although Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is the oldest member of the branch, she is always an example of being hard-working, and using the borrowed money effectively. She joins the Fund since the very beginning. Her living circumstance at that time was very difficult. She and her husband only worked on the rice field and they had to send 5 children to school. At first, she borrowed 50 USD and used it in breeding animals, and selling vegetables in the market. Her life started changing when she bought a piece of land and started breeding animals, fishes and planting. After difficult years, her business is going very well. When I came down to see her, she just released a farrow of pigs and earned 1000 USD. Currently, there are 4 pigs and tons of fishes almost ready. Business is going well, her family economy is becoming stable. Her children are all grown-up and living separately. Being 58 years old, she is having a happy life. She wants to become a long-term member of the Fund so that she can borrow more money to expand her business. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more fishes and food for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là thành viên cao tuổi nhất trong cụm nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị Hoà luôn là tấm gương điển hình về sự cần cù, chịu khó và sử dụng vốn rất có hiệu quả. Chị tham gia từ những ngày đầu khi Quỹ về với địa bàn xã Phúc thắng cũ. Hoàn cảnh gia đình lúc bấy giờ có rất nhiều khó khăn, vất vả, hai vợ chồng ngoài làm ruộng ra cũng không có thu nhập gì thêm lại phải nuôi 5 đứa con ăn học. Số tiền vay 50USD ban đầu được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhỏ, hàng ngày mớ rau, mớ cỏ mang ra chợ bán. Cuộc sống thật sự thay đổi khi gia đình chị xin đấu thầu thêm 1 mẫu ruộng của hợp tác xã xây chuồng trại, đào ao thả cá, trồng cây ăn quả. Sau nhiều năm vất vả đến nay thành quả mà chị và gia đình đầu tư đã và đang cho thu nhập rất tốt. Khi tôi đến chị vừa cho xuất chuồng lứa lợn giá 1000USD, hiện tại trong chuồng còn hơn 4 tạ lợn thịt, vài tạ cá cũng đến kỳ cho thu nhập. Kinh tế phát triển, các con của chị cũng đã trưởng thành, xây dựng gia đình và đã ra ở riêng. Bước vào tuổi 58 chị Hòa rất vui và tâm sự được tham gia Quỹ là niềm hạnh phúc lớn trong đời chị. Chị mong muốn sẽ tham gia lâu dài để tiếp tục vay vốn phát triển dự án. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD mua cá giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy fishes, food for pigs

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Mr. Isidro D. has been working in the food business by selling tacos for more than twenty years. He and his wife work in this business, which is their main source of income and helps them support their family. The business is going well, but they would like to buy more merchandise and fixtures for their business. They are asking for a loan of $1000 that will be used to buy merchandise and furniture for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

EL Sr. Isidro D. tiene ya más de 20 años en el negocio de venta de tacos. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Gracias a dios no esta yendo muy bien en el negocio pero queremos comprar mas mercancía y inmobiliario para el negocio. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de inmobiliario y mercancía para el negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and furniture for their business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 55 years old, has more than 10 years experience in educating. In 1996, she retired and her pension was not enough for her to live by. Her daily activity at that time was selling vegetables in the market. Even her low income did not help much for her living. In 2000. when the TYM Fund came to the area, she enthusiastically joined and also encouraged other people to join. Realizing the need of baby-sitters from many family, she bravely asked the authority to open a private kindergarten. Currently, her kindergarten is operating very well. It has 2 classrooms, 4 licensed teachers and 70 childrens. Many families send their kids to Hong N. kindergarten because Mrs. N. is very reliable. Her wish is to borrow money to expand her kindergarten, buy more children toys, satisfying the demands from the families. This time she wants to borrow 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Với kinh nghiệm hơn 10 năm nuôi dạy trẻ và công tác trong ngành giáo dục, dự án mà chị Nguyễn Thị Ngát, 55 tuổi đầu tư là một trong số ít dự án điển hình của chi nhánh nói chung và của phường nói riêng. Năm 1996 chị nghỉ hưu theo chế độ một cục, số tiền chẳng được bao nhiêu nên cuộc sống cũng rất vất vả. Công việc hàng ngày của chị lúc ấy là mang vài mớ rau cỏ ra chợ bán. Thu nhập thấp không đủ chi tiêu cho cuộc sống hàng ngày. Năm 2000 khi Quỹ về, chị mạnh dạn tham gia và vận động một số chị em cùng vay vốn. Nhận thấy nhu cầu trông giữ trẻ của nhiều gia đình, chị đã mạnh dạn xin chính quyền địa phương cấp giấy đăng ký mở lớp mầm non tư thục. Hiện tại công việc của chị đang tiến triển rất thuận lợi với cơ ngơi khá khang trang, sạch đẹp với 2 phòng học, 4 cô giáo trực tiếp nuôi giữ trẻ có trình độ chuyên môn được đào tạo chính quy và hơn 70 trẻ. Lớp mầm non tư thục Hồng Ngát do chị làm chủ rất có tín nhiệm nên nhiều gia đình muốn gửi con đến đây. Mong muốn của chị Ngát là muốn vay vốn lớn hơn để đầu tư mở rộng trường lớp, trang thiết bị đồ chơi cho trẻ, đáp ứng nhiều hơn nhu cầu của các gia đình có con nhỏ. Vòng vốn này chị đăng ký xin vay 1200USD.

loans.use: expand kindergarten, buy toys for children

loans.name: Ma. Antonieta Martin

texts.es:
I have been in the grocery business for more than three years now. It is the main source of income for my family. My husband and I  are both working and would like to invest more in the business without bankrupting ourselves. We are requesting a loan of $1,200 so that we can buy more merchandise for the grocery store.

 Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer 


Tengo ya mas de 3 años con un negocio de abarrotes este  negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Queremos invertirle más al negocio sin descapitalizarnos. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía para el negocio de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn M., 31, a fish seller in Om Pel Village, is married with three children.  Although of limited education, she operates her business efficiently. Her husband, Phen Ken, is a fisherman on Lake Boeung. Morn assists him in his fishing; they then sell the catch.  Both of them can generate an income of around $5 a day. Morn now requests a loan of $275 to buy a new boat and fish net for the business.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fish net.

loans.name: Sonia Sanjuana

texts.es:
Thanks to my other loan I was able to buy new clothes, of better quality, different sizes and models, and as a result my business has grown and I have more clients. I would like to buy a tarp so that I can roof the place where I sell my merchandise so that during the summer season the sun does not damage the clothes. I am requesting a loan of $500 in order to buy the tent that will protect my merchandise from the sun and will make my clients more comfortable while browsing through the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Gracias por el préstamo pude comprar ropa nueva, de mejor calidad, diferentes talla y modelos el negocio a crecido bastante y tengo mas clientes. Me gustaría mucho compara una carpa de lona para techar el lugar donde vendo para esta temporada de calor y con el sol no se vayan a dañar la ropa. Solicito un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls para la comprar de una carpa de lona para cubrir la mercancía del sol y que los clientes al ver la mercancía no estén incómodos.

loans.use: To buy a tent for my business.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Meourn M., 40, is married with 6 children, 2 of whom work in a garment factory earning about $3 each per day.  The others are students. Meourn is a fish seller, and she also works on a lake fishing with her husband, Ry Thel.  She typically earns around $6 per day from selling fish. Now, she would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a new boat and more fish nets to help in her business

loans.use: To buy a boat and fish nets.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Mrs. Lin Y. lives in Om Pel village, which is located in Kandal Province. Lin, 23, is married with two pre school age children, and is in the business of selling fish. Her husband, Kroy Tim, is a fisherman who works on Lake Boeung. She and Kroy typically fish together and then sell their catches at a local market to support their family. They usually earn about $5 per day. She would now like to request a loan of  $175 to buy more fish nets to help in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish nets.

loans.name: Ni Komang Partini

texts.id:
Ni Komang Partini is a wife of a local school teacher. She opens a canteen at the school where her husband teaches. This school canteen is managed together with other school teachers' wives and they sell in turn. Ni Komang Partini gets one week time slot in a month to sell her stuffs at the school canteen. She sells stuffs favored by the school kids such as traditional snack, rice, drinks etc.

Apart from this, she also opens a small general store at her house. She started this business with initial capital of IDR 1 million (approx of USD 105). In her small stores, she sells snack, drink and daily necessities.

With the loan money, she plans to add the merchandise by selling pig feed as there are a lot of pig farmers in the neighborhood. She hopes this can increase the stores' revenue.

With the increases in revenue, she will be able to have more money to fund the education of her two children who are studying in university in Java island. She also hopes that this will make her business more successful.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Biar pun sebagai istri seorang guru, namun Ni Komang Partini tetap ulet bekerja. Partini membuka kantin disekolah dimana tempat suaminya mengajar. Selain itu juga membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000.- Partini memulai usaha ini. Jenis barang dagangan yang dijual dikantin sekolah seperti jajan tradisional, nasi, buah-buahan, minuman dan juga makanan ringan yang sangat digemari oleh anak –anak. Untuk dikantin sekolah Partini berjualan dengan cara bergilir dengan istri-istri guru yang lain. Dalam satu bulan Partini mendapat giliran berdagang sebanyak 1 minggu dan kesempatan ini dipergunakan sebaik – baiknya. Partini mulai berjualan dari pagi hari sampai siang hari sesuai dengan waktu sekolah. Selanjutnya Partini berdagang dirumahnya. Untuk dirumah, Partini juga menyediakan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan ringan, minuman dan semua kebutuhan pokok. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Partini berencana untuk menjual pakan ternak seperti dedak padi dan juga dedak gandum yang sangat dibutuhkan oleh para peternak yang ada disekitar tempat tinggalnya. Dengan adanya tambahan jenis barang dagangan, Partini yakin akan mendapatkan keuntungan lebih. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membiayai pendidikan kedua anaknya yang masih kuliah di Jawa. Rumahnya dibangun sendiri ditanah mertuanya dan hidup berdekatan dengan semua keluarganya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh,usahanya semakin maju dan berkembang.

loans.use: To add working capital and to buy more merchandise (Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli barang dagangan)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Komang Yudi Artin

texts.id:
Ni Komang Yudi Artini is a school teacher at a local kindergarten. LIving in a village is enabling her to have additional activities as a pig farmer. With initial capital of IDR 1.2 million (approx of USD 125), she has 4 piglets which are raised at her backyard. The expensive price of pig feed troubles her as she does not have enough capital. With the help from Dinari, she will be able to buy pig feed and another 3 piglets. She hopes that her farming activities can be a successful one.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Hidup di desa membuat Ni Komang Yudi Artini yang bekerja sebagai Guru TK juga mempunyai usaha yang produktif, yaitu beternak babi. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.200.000.- Ni KomangYudi membeli 4 ekor bibit babi yang dipelihara dibelakang rumahnya. Harga pakan yang mahal membuat Ni Komang Yudi kebingungan dalam mencari modal. Dengan bantuan dari Dinari, Ni Komang Yudi bisa membeli pakan dan juga tambahan 3 ekor bibit babi lagi. Ni Komang Yudi memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari Kandangnya dibersihkan setiap hari, sebelum Ni Komang Yudi memberi makan ternaknya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diberikan usahanya akan semakin meningkat.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudarni

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sudarni is a housewife who is diligently assisting her husband to earn additional income. Her husband, I Gede Suparmita is a trader/ merchant. Ni Ketut Sudarmi raises pigs at her house. With initial capital of IDR 1.2 million (approx of USD 125), she bought 4 piglets which after 4 months can be sold for IDR 800 thousand to IDR 1 million per pig (approx of USD 85 to USD 105/ pig). She feeds her piglets twice a day with wheat and paddy and also with various leaves. The profit that she can earn from this pigs is used to meet her family daily needs and also to finance the education of her two children who are still in kindergarten and 4th grade of primary school. The loan money will be used to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sudarni seorang ibu yang ulet bekerja untuk membantu suaminya, I Gede Suparmita, yang berprofesi sebagai Pedagang. Ni Ketut Sudarni juga memelihara babi dirumahnya yaitu babi penggemukan. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.200.000.- Ni Ketut Sudarni membeli 4 ekor bibit babi setelah dipelihara selama 4 bulan, babi-babinya siap dijual dengan harga perekor dari Rp. 800.000.- sampai dengan Rp.1.000.000.- Ni Ketut Sudarni memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari. Disamping dedak padi dan juga dedak gandum, Ni Ketut Sudarni juga memberikan makanan tambahan seperti daun talas, daun pisang dan batang pisang. Keuntungan yang didapat dari pemeliharaan babi ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga dan juga untuk pendidikan kedua anaknya yang duduk dikelas 4 SD dan TK. Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Ni Ketut Sudarni akan membeli beberapa ekor bibit babi lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Belen Cerro De Oro (Group 1)

texts.en:
Across from school’s cement courtyard, where turkeys spread their tails, mocking the unfortunate fate of the fried chickens being sold for lunch, sit 28 women under the shade of an avocado tree. Shifting periodically to avoid the sun's glare as it tracks across the sky, the women of the Belen communal bank are perched on rocks, steps or sitting flat on the ground, waiting for their meeting to begin. They have come from all over their town of Cerro de Oro, by foot, tuc tuc, or bus, to this central spot where they have been meeting once a month for the past seven years. Surrounded by poverty, this avocado tree brings them hope with each meeting. It is under this tree that they receive their loans from Friendship Bridge and learn how to best invest to change their futures.

The majority of the 28 women are artisans, born and raised in a region known for its beautiful weavings. Of the 28 women, 11 are asking for a loan of 32,500 quetzales ($4,275), ranging from $300 to $400 per person. All of these women will invest their loans in weaving and embroidery businesses, purchasing thread and fabric for intricate huipiles (traditional woven blouses, like the ones in the picture), skirts, scarves, and blankets. The supplies they purchase come from the nearby town of Santiago de Atitlán. One woman also sells firewood, the main source of fuel in the area, to supplement her weaving business. She will use about 25% of her loan to invest in firewood.

Long before the monthly meetings under the avocado tree, the women of Belen worked long days in the factories of other weavers, earning meager incomes that could barely provide food or shelter for their families. Since joining Friendship Bridge, all 28 women have become their own bosses, opening their own businesses, employing as many as five other women in turn. They are also teaching their daughters the trade, which is an important aspect of the Atitlán culture. However, their dreams go further for their children. Their children all attend the local school, and their mothers dream that they will learn to read and write, acquiring knowledge of other things, so that someday they can break free from the struggles of their parents and enter a world full of opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and weaving thread

loans.name: Prek Svay Ii Group

texts.en: All of the people in the picture are the borrowers from the Prek Svay II Village Bank in Kandal Province. Mr Nem N., 45, is a farmer and banana seller and also the Village Bank president. He is married with four children; three work in the factory near his house and one is a student. He would like to request a loan of $2800 in order to buy a pig as well as more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a pig and more bananas to sell

loans.name: Belen Cerro De Oro (Group 2)

texts.en:
The road into Cerro de Oro cuts through lush forests, passing by men with machetes chopping away, others carrying their day’s gatherings on their backs to be sold as firewood in town. Along the forests are thousands of rocks, several serving as billboards for political slogans, too many others as memorials. The road opens up to an emerging little town, with a school on the right, and an avocado tree on the left. Underneath the avocado tree sit 28 women, vying for the relief its branches offer from the unforgiving sun. They have gathered here once a month for the past seven years. The women of the Belen communal bank have overcome insurmountable odds, one loan at a time.

The women of Belen come from a region rich in weaving, and many grew up learning the intricate art from their parents. From the time they were young, they were working for meager wages in weaving factories, earning barely enough to survive, with no way to get ahead. After joining Friendship Bridge, they were given the initial push they needed to escape their poverty. Today, seven years later, every single woman has her own weaving business, earning a fair income that supports their families and even enough to send all their children to school. They wear this success with a humble pride, supporting each other in their victories and obstacles.

Ten of the 28 women are asking for a loan of 28,000 quetzales ($3,675), ranging from $300 to $400 per person. Nine of the women will invest this money in their weaving businesses, purchasing thread to weave intricate huipiles (traditional blouses like the ones in the picture), skirts, scarves, and blankets. A single huipil can take up to a month to make, and after an initial investment of about 200 quetzales ($25), it can be sold for around 500 quetzales ($65). All the supplies are purchased in the nearby town of Santiago de Atitlán. A few of the women also employ as many as five other women, and part of the loan will go towards paying their salaries. Having the extra help greatly increases production (which is essential when a single product takes a month to make), and therefore adds significantly to the potential income. One woman also runs a small store, selling snacks, soft drinks and daily necessities such as soap and toilet paper. She plans to restock her store and add new varieties of snacks to keep her customers interested.

The women of Belen have come very far over the past seven years and they don’t plan on stopping. They want to expand their businesses; the ones who currently work alone would like to someday hire help. They would also like to expand to other nearby markets, bringing in new customers. Everything they do is for the future of their children, and their dreams revolve around educating their children, with the hope that they can learn to read and write, and someday become professionals, free of the hardships of their parents.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and inventory for store

loans.name: Belen Cerro De Oro (Group 3)

texts.en:
Stirring up dust and old leaves, the wind blows through a small playground, where the 28 women of the Belen communal bank gather beneath the shade of the avocado tree. They know this place well, having met here monthly for the past seven years. The breeze offers relief from the scorching sun, and the women adjust themselves according to the patches of shade lent by the familiar tree.

The women of Belen are gentle but strong, their weathered faces wearing smiles of hope and determination. They have struggled immensely to arrive where they are today and every loan they receive offers another step out of poverty. Most of the women are weavers, having learnt the art as small children, and growing up to work in weaving factories, earning barely enough to survive. Now, after seven years with Friendship Bridge, every single woman has her own business, earning a fair income that provides for her family. Some of the women even employ as many as five other women.

Of the 28 women, seven are asking for a loan of 20,000 quetzales ($2,625), ranging from $300 to $400 per person. Six of the women will invest their money in their weaving businesses, purchasing colorful thread for beautiful huipiles (traditional woven blouses, like the ones in the photo), skirts, scarves, and blankets. They purchase weaving materials in the nearby town of Santiago de Atitlán. A couple of the women will also use part of their loans to pay their employees. One woman runs a business buying and selling corn and beans. Every two days she goes into town (about a 30 minute ride) and purchases corn and beans in bulk. She then brings it back to her town of Cerro de Oro and sells it to the locals. She will use her loan to purchase larger quantities of these products.

The women of Belen give thanks to Friendship Bridge for how far they’ve come, and they are eager to start another loan cycle to see what they can achieve. Six of the seven women have children (one woman is sadly unable to bear children, to her disappointment). They dream that their children will attend school, learn to read and write, and gain the tools necessary to end their families' bitter cycle of poverty forever.

loans.use: To purchase weaving thread, as well as corn and beans in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more equipment and hire more employees

loans.name: Kampongsvay Ler I Group

texts.en: This is a group loan that will be shared among 19 members of the Kampongsvay Ler I Village Bank. Mrs Yeang S., 58, is a farmer and pig seller and also the Village Bank president. She is married with one married child. She and the Village Bank would like to request a loan of $2725 in order to buy pigs to sell on a daily basis.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of curios

loans.name: Kireka C1 C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nulu N.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to purchase a cow. Nulu is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 7 children ranging from age 9 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Nulu makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Nulu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Nulu is joined in her small group by Tender N., Teddy N., Rose N., and Harriet N.. Tender N. has a business selling raw food and wants to purchase in bulk.
