Luz, Maribel and Elisabeth need loans for 1000 soles, 400 soles and 200 soles. This amount will be invested in buying a tent, pots, plates, sugar, flaxseed, rice and a portion of this loan will be used for Maribel son's medical expenses.

Their dreams are to finish their studies and work, grow their businesses, build their homes and help their children become professionals in the workplace.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz, Maribel y Elisabeth pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Musuq Rumi” que significa “Nueva Piedra” en quechua, hace 8, 4, 8 meses respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, como invertir el dinero, a ahorrar y que se puede salir de las dificultades.

Luz es soltera y tiene 20 años, Luz junto a su mama venden comida en el mercado Magdalena. Luz con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio, venderá caldo de gallina en una carpa los días lunes.

Por otro lado Maribel es madre soltera, tiene 28 años y 4 hijos, Maribel vende emoliente, (bebida caliente elaborada con hierbas y semillas de lino, contiene propiedades curativas), de manera ambulante en el mercado Magdalena. Además Maribel en épocas vende frutas de la región.

Mientras que Elisabeth es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Elisabeth vende comidas los días viernes y sábados en las ferias de Ccejelambras y Chontaca. Algunas veces Elisabeth vende comidas en diferentes obras de construcción. Elisabeth tiene proyectado abrir una tienda de abarrotes.

Luz, Maribel y Elisabeth necesitan prestamos de 1000 soles, 400 soles, 200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos, carpa, azúcar, linaza, arroz y una parte del préstamo de Maribel será para los gastos médicos de su hijo.

Los sueños de Luz, Maribel y Elisabeth son terminar su carrera y trabajar, tener un negocio mas grande, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Luz, Maribel and Elisabeth need loans for 1000 soles, 400 soles and 200 soles. This amount will be invested in buying a tent, pots, plates, sugar,  flaxseed, rice and a portion of this loan will be used for Maribel son's medical expenses.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Phương, 37, is a TYM member since 1998. Before joining TYM, her family was in financial difficulty. There are 4 members in her family and the only income is from their small piece of land of 4/10 acre. Their combined annual income was just few hundreds USD. Despite the fact that her husband is a skilled carpenter and since they did not have capital to invest in a business, he had to work for someone else with low wage. Things have changed when Mrs Phương received a loan from TYM and they had decided to open a shop at home making wooden furniture. Their products are of quality and they have gained trust from their customers so their business was growing strong. Today, their income is around 300 USD a month. This type of business is booming in the area so Mrs Phương is requesting a new loan of 1200 USD to stock up on wood and stop buying with credit. Mrs Phương and her family live in ý Yên, Nam Định. She has 2 children aged 17 & 15.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương, 37 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình có nhiều khó khăn, 1 nhà 4 miệng ăn chỉ trông vào 4 sào ruộng. Thu nhập cả năm chỉ khoảng vài trăm USD. Mặc dù có tay nghề mộc nhưng do không có vốn nên anh Hưng, chồng chị phải đi làm thuê với mức lương thấp. Mọi việc đã thay đổi khi chị Phương được vay vốn từ Quỹ. Chị bàn với chồng mua gỗ mở xưởng mộc tại nhà. Hàng làm ra chất lượng và uy tín nên rất nhiều khách đến đặt mua. Mức thu nhập hiện nay 300USD/tháng. Nghề đồ gỗ đang phát triển nên chị Phương rất muốn được vay thêm 1200USD để mua gỗ về làm hàng, không phải đi mua chịu bên ngoài. Chị Phương hiện đang sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Chị có 2 con 17 và 15 tuổi.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi H. is one of the youngest members of TYM Fund branch in Y Yen District (TYM Fund is Kiva's partner in Vietnam). She has joined TYM Fund since 2004, when she was 19 years old. She uses the loan to open a grocery store. At the beginning, she just intended it to be a temporary job while she has to stay home take care of her baby. After a while, the profit from her store has gradually become the main income of her family. Each month, after deducting costs, she earns about 130-150USD. She wants to borrow 650USD to buy inventories for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Huyền là một trong những thành viên trẻ tuổi nhất của chi nhánh ý Yên. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2004 khi mới 19 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện nay gồm 2 vợ chồng và 1 con nhỏ 2 tuổi. Sống ở thị trấn, ruộng đất ít nên mỗi vụ thu hoạch chỉ đủ ăn. Sau khi vào Quỹ chị Huyền vay vốn về mở quầy bán hàng tạp hóa. Thời gian đầu chị cũng chỉ có ý định tận dụng khoảng thời gian ở nhà trông con nhỏ. Sau một thời gian, hàng bán được, thu nhập từ quầy hàng dần trở thành thu nhập chính của gia đình. Hàng tháng trừ chi phí chị Huyền thu 130-150USD. Vòng vốn này chị muốn vay thêm 650USD về mua hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery store

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi H., 40 years old, lives with her husband and her two children in Y Yen, Nam Dinh province. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) since 1998. Before, she uses most of her loans to buy recycles. Every morning she bikes around 20-30km away from home to nearby villages to collect recycles. She then sells it to the recycling company, earning 3-4USD a day. The change in income is not a whole lot, but at least it's stable. This year Mrs. H. decided to open a small breakfast restaurant. The job is rather difficult, but the good thing is that she will not to go too far every morning like before, which is better for her age. Furthermore, her two kids can also help out in their free time. Mrs. H. would like to borrow 525USD to buy tables, chairs, and cooking utensils to prepare for her new restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Hồ, 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Thời gian trước vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Hồ dùng chủ yếu vào việc thu mua phế liệu. Hàng tuần chị dành hầu hết các buổi sáng đạp xe cách nhà kH.ảng 20-30km, sang các địa phương lân cận mua sắt vụn về bán cH. các cơ sở thu mua. Mỗi ngày trung bình chị kiếm được kH.ảng 3-4USD. Kinh tế gia đình chưa có những thay đổi rõ nét nhưng có thu nhập thường xuyên. Sang năm nay chị Hồ quyết định chuyển sang bán hàng ăn sáng. Công việc tuy cũng khá vất vả nhưng ít phải đi xa, phù hợp với lứa tuổi của chị hơn. Hai con chị cũng có thể hỗ trợ mẹ ít nhiều. Chị Hồ muốn vay 525USD để mua bàn, ghế, nồi niêu ... phục vụ cH. việc bán hàng.

loans.use: Buy table, chair, cooker for restaurant

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Truong Thi B., now 47 years old, has been with TYM since 1997. She currently lives with her husband at Y Yen District of Nam Dinh Province. She has two children who have both grown up and have a job of their own. In the previous loans, Mrs. B. put the money in her pig-breeding and recycling materials businesses. The majority of her own money was used for the pig-breeding business, which is also the main source of her family's income. Normally she would be able to sell each farrow of pigs for about 500 to 700 USD. At the same time, by collecting recycling materials and resell it, she got enough money to pay the monthly payment (for TYM) as well as for the household daily activities. In 2004, seeing that her age would not allow her to continue with this work anymore, she moved into the husking rice business. This business has been doing quite well, with her monthly income of around 150 USD. In this loan cycle, she would like to ask for a loan of 450 USD to buy petroleum and repair her machines.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trương Thị Bích, 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1997. Chị sống cùng chồng tại huyện ý Yên, Nam Định. Hai con chị đã trưởng thành và có công ăn việc làm. Trước kia chị Bích vay vốn về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán phế liệu. Tiền vốn được chị dành chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi lợn. Đây cũng là nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình. Sau mỗi lần bán lợn chị thu về 500-700USD. Chị cũng dành một số ít vốn cho việc thu mua phế liệu. Nguồn thu nhập từ công việc này giúp chị có tiền trả tuần và trang trải chi phí hàng ngày. Năm 2004, cảm thấy việc đi mua phế liệu không còn phù hợp với tuổi nên chị chuyển sang làm máy xay xát gạo. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, thu nhập hàng tháng chị Bích khoảng 150USD. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD về sửa sang và mua dầu chạy máy.

loans.use: Buy petroleum, repair machine

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Truong Thi H., 40 years old, is currently living at Lam Commune of Nam Dinh province with her husband and their three children. She joined TYM in 1998 when the family was still having many financial difficulties (little land for farming, all her children are in school, doesn't have a stable source of income). Determined to overcome these hardships, she took out a loan of 50 USD to breed pig. After each farrow of pigs was sold, she was able to either buy furniture for the household or pay for her children's tuition fee. Her biggest wish is to see her children finishing their schooling and have a stable jobs later on. In this loan cycle, she would like to take out 400 USD to repair her breeding facilities and buy more breeding-pig.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trương Thị Huệ, 40 tuổi, sống tại thị trấn Lâm, Nam Định cùng chồng và 3 con. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Hoàn cảnh kinh tế gia đình lúc đó có nhiều khó khăn: ruộng ít, các con đang độ tuổi ăn học nên chi phí tốn kém. Với mục đích cải thiện đời sống, chị Huệ xin vay mức vốn 50USD đầu tư nuôi lợn. Mỗi lần bán một lứa lợn chị Huệ lại có thêm một khoản tiền để sắm sửa vật dụng trong gia đình hoặc trả học phí cho con. Kinh tế qua các năm dần được nâng lên. Mong muốn lớn nhất lúc này của chị Huệ là được thấy các con ăn học nên người. Vòng vốn này chị muốn vay thêm 400USD sửa sang chuồng trại và mua giống lợn về nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 55 years old, have joined TYM since 1998. Her husband and her along with their son, his wife and his small child are all living under one roof in Y Yen Commune of Nam Dinh Province. Despite her age, Mrs. H. still doesn't want to totally depending on her children. Her main job is selling grain rice. Her previous loans was used to purchaserice from farmers and then reselling them at the market. This source of income is not very stable but on average she got a profit of 3-4 USD per day. These money were enough to repay the loan as well as paying for the couple's daily activities. For this loan cycle, she would like to take out 400 USD to buy rice for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hàm, 55 tuổi, tH. gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 5 người, anh chị, hai vợ chồng người con trai và 1 cháu nhỏ. Họ đang sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Tuy tuổi đã nhiều nhưng chị Hàm không muốn hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào con cái. Công việc chủ yếu của chị hiện nay cũng như trước kia là buôn bán gạo. Những đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị sử dụng mua gạo từ những hộ nông dân sau đó bán lại ngoài chợ. Thu nhập cao hay thấp tùy thuộc vào giá gạo và lượng vốn đầu tư. Trung bình một ngày chị Hàm thu từ 3-4USD. Số tiền này ngoài việc trả tiền tuần cũng đủ chi dùng cho cuộc sống của 2 vợ chồng. Năm nay chị muốn vay thêm 400USD làm vốn mua gạo về bán.

loans.use: Buy rice

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hoàng Thị Ngoán is 54 years old. She lives in ý Yên, Nam Định with her husband and 2 children. She joined TYM fund in 1998. Like the majority of the villagers, her main occupation is farming and raising pigs. Before joining TYM, she did not have any capital to start up a business so her income was just barely sufficient for her family. After joining TYM, the loan was well invested in the pig raising business so her income was steadily increasing. Now on average, she makes 100 USD a month. Mrs Ngoán also sells basic goods at the market: vegetables, eggs ...etc. to make the weekly payment. Her husband and 2 children do help her out when she is overloaded with work. This time Mrs Ngoán is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy a new batch of piglets to replace the ones that she sold during the Tet holidays.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Ngoán, 50 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Như phần lớn các gia đình trong vùng, công việc chủ yếu của chị Ngoán là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ, do ít vốn nên thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi chỉ đủ nuôi sống gia đình. Sau khi vào Quỹ, có thêm vốn nên việc chăn nuôi được mở rộng, thu nhập cũng tăng lên. Lãi bình quân hàng tháng từ việc chăn nuôi hiện nay là 100USD. Để có tiền hoàn trả hàng tuần, chị Ngoán cũng tích cực chạy chợ, khi mớ rau, khi quả trứng. Những lúc khó khăn chồng và hai con cũng tích cực hỗ trợ chị. Vòng vốn này chị Ngoán xin vay 400USD để mua lợn con thay cho lứa lợn mới xuất chuồng dịp Tết.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Tâm, 40, lives in Lâm town, Nam Định. She is married and has a 16 years old son. She is a 11th year TYM fund member, branch 5. Since she lives in a town, there is not much land to cultivate. The income generated by her small piece of land is barely enough. To increase her wage, she also sells basic goods. Her husband is employed at a metal shop. She finds that it would be very difficult to increase her income if she keeps on doing what she's been doing so she has decided to apply for a loan to invest more in farming, renovating and expanding her pig pen. She would also exploit her land for vegetable cultivation. She's requesting a loan of 400 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Tâm, 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và một con trai 16 tuổi tại thị trấn Lâm, Nam Định. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 11 của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 5. Nằm trong khu vực thị trấn nên ruộng đất ít, nếu trông vào mấy sào ruộng thì chỉ đủ ăn. Để tăng thêm thu nhập chị Tâm thu mua phế liệu về bán. Chồng chị, anh Thuyết cũng đi làm thuê cho xưởng đúc đồng. Thu nhập thường xuyên nhưng chị Tâm nhận thấy nếu tiếp tục công việc này thì khó có được những món tiền lớn. Chị muốn vay vốn về sửa sang chuồng trại và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng muốn có một ít tiền dành cho việc chăm bón mảnh vườn trồng rau của gia đình. Mức vốn chị đề nghị cho dự án này là 400USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs and fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị S. is 38. She lives in ý Yên, Nam Định. Her family is composed of 4 members: her husband & her 2 children who are 11 and 9. For the last few years, there have been a lot of new construction in the area. So beside working on her rice filed, Mrs S. also has a rental business: she rents scaffolds. This is a good business where overhead is very low. She just needs initial capital to buy scaffolds. For each scaffold that she rents, she makes dozens of USD, depending on the duration of the rental. Since there is a boom right now in construction, she always runs out of scaffolds to rent. Mrs S. consulted with her husband and she decided to apply for a loan from TYM. She is requesting 325 USD to buy more scaffolds

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị S., 38 tuổi, đang sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Gia đình chị gồm hai vợ chồng và 2 con, cháu đầu 11, cháu sau 9 tuổi. Những năm gần đây nhu cầu xây dựng tăng mạnh nên ngoài làm ruộng chị S. còn cho thuê cốt pha. Đây là một nghề dễ mang lại thu nhập, chi phí hao mòn công cụ thấp. Sau khi bỏ tiền mua cốt pha, chị S. cho những người có nhu cầu thuê lại. Tiền thuê tùy thuộc vào số ngày thuê và diện tích xây dựng lớn hay nhỏ. Mỗi lần trung bình chị thu khoảng vài chục USD. Thời gian này nhiều nhà dân và cơ sở kinh doanh trong vùng được dựng lên nên số lượng cốt pha luôn được thuê hết. Chị S. bàn với chồng và xin tham gia Quỹ Tình thương đầu năm 2008. Vòng vốn đầu tiên này chị xin vay 325USD để mua thêm cốt pha.

loans.use: Buy scaffold

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
I have the need of constructing a room in front of my home. I have a very small home, but because of my economic situation, it is difficult to buy a bigger house. I work in an assembly plant and this job provides me with a discounted mortgage. In order to make my home more comfortable, I am sure I need to expand my house. I request $1000 in order to construct this room in front of my home.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de construir un cuarto enfrente de mi vivienda, como pueden ver es muy pequeña pero debido a la situación económica es difícil comprar una más grande, trabajo en una planta maquiladora y a través de ahí pude tener acceso a un crédito de vivienda la cual me descuentan de mi sueldo semanal, para que mi familia este más cómoda y segura tengo que hacer una ampliación”. Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para construir un cuarto al frente de mi vivienda.

loans.use: The construction of a room.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Tuyết is 24. She is married and has 2 young children. They live in Yên, Nam Định. Since they live in a town so there is not much land to cultivate. To make ends meet, she makes artisana: pots, flower vases. Her items sell anywhere from a few dollars to a few dozens dollars. She sells enough to make a decent living out of it. To increase her wage, in 2005 she joined TYM and got a loan of 125 USD to invest in her business. After a few rounds, her business started to pick up so she applied for bigger loans. This time she is requesting 400 USD to buy material for her pot and vases.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Tuyết, 24 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Sống tại khu vực thị trấn, ruộng đất ít nên để có đủ tiền trang trải cho cuộc sống gia đình, chị làm nghề phụ là gia công hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ. Mặt hàng chủ yếu chị thường làm là các loại bình, chậu để cắm hoa cây cảnh. Mỗi sản phẩm làm ra có giá từ vài USD đến vài chục USD. Hàng bán chạy nên thu nhập cũng ổn định. Để tăng thêm vốn sản xuất, năm 2005, chị Tuyết tham gia Quỹ Tình thương. Mức vốn vay ban đầu là 125USD. Sau vài vòng vốn, thấy đồng vốn vay được sử dụng hiệu quả, chị Tuyết xin vay các mức vốn cao hơn. Mức vốn chị đề nghị lần này là 400USD để mua nguyên liệu làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy clay to make pots, vases

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Quả, 54 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2008. She lives with her husband and 3 children, two are still in school. Besides farming she raises pigs for extra income. Because of small capital, the income from pigs has been modest. In 2008, she decides to join and apply for a loan at the Fund to invest in her pigs operation. She agrees with the initial maximum amount that set for her at 325USD. She hopes the income will be better this year.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Quả, 54 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2008. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 người con, trong đó 2 người đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Ngoài làm ruộng chị Quả còn chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thu nhập. Do ít vốn nên thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi Q. các năm trước chỉ bình thường. Sang năm 2008 này, thấy nhiều chị em trong xã vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương và sử dụng hiệu quả, chị Quả quyết định xin tham gia và vay vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Mức đề nghị của chị ở vòng vốn đầu tiên là mức tối đa 325USD theo quy định của Quỹ. Chị hy vọng thu nhập năm nay sẽ có nhiều tiến triển so với năm trước.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Hiệu, 37 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund for nine years. She’s been taking out loans from the Fund to invest in her glove making business. Her steady income is convenient for the weekly repayment plan. Her daily income is from 3 to 4USD. Her youngest son, 10 years old, helps his mom after school somewhat. She is applying for a loan of 325USD to buy material. She lives with her husband and two children in Ý Yên, Nam Định.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Hiệu, 37 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 9 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trong các năm tham gia, chị thường sử dụng đồng vốn vay vào việc mua vải may găng tay. Đây là một công việc mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên rất thuận lợi cho việc trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập từ việc bán găng tay mỗi ngày khoảng 3-4USD. Con út của chị Hiệu năm nay lên 10 tuổi, ngoài giờ đi học cũng giúp đỡ mẹ ít nhiều. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay thêm 325USD về mua vải. Chị Hiệu hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy clothes to make gloves

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Pig farming is popular in Yên Trị. To the family of Mrs. Trần Thị Yến, 40 years old, the primary income is from pig farming. In previous years, due to lack of funds, the income has been modest. In early 2007, she took out a 200USD loan from the TYM Fund to expand her pig farm. At the end of the year, the income improves a little. Though not much but that encourages her to take out more loan. She is applying for a loan of 400USD to buy piglets. Her husband and 3 children support her decision heartedly.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chăn nuôi lợn là một công việc phổ biến của người dân xã Yên Trị nói riêng và người nông dân nói chung. Đối với gia đình chị Trần Thị Yến, 40 tuổi, đây cũng là nguồn thu chủ yếu. Các năm trước chị thường dùng nguồn vốn tự có của gia đình nên thu nhập từ hoạt động này chưa cao. Đầu năm 2007 chị vay từ Quỹ Tình thương số vốn 200USD mở rộng dự án. Thu nhập cuối năm tăng lên vài chục USD so với trước. Số tiền tuy chưa nhiều nhưng là một sự khích lệ với chị Yến về việc sử dụng nguồn vốn vay từ bên ngoài. Sang năm nay chị tiếp tục xin vay 400USD về mua lợn con. Chồng và 3 người con của chị Yến đều nhất trí và ủng hộ quyết định này.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
The broad smiles and the enthusiasm of Ms. Vũ Thị Hương, 25 years old, is the main factor of her successful beauty salon. She is single and has had her salon for 2 years now. After 6 months of vocational training from big town, she came home and opened her own shop. To get the capital she joined the TYM Fund. The monthly income is hefty at 200USD. She is applying for a loan of 825USD to expand her salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Thái độ niềm nở, nụ cười luôn thường trực trên môi là một yếu tố làm cho cửa hàng của chị Vũ Thị Hương lúc nào cũng đông khách. 25 tuổi, chưa lập gia đình, chị Hương làm nghề trang điểm phụ nữ được 2 năm nay. Sau thời gian 6 tháng học nghề tại cửa hàng trang điểm trên thị trấn, chị Hương về địa phương tự mở cửa hàng của riêng mình. Để có thêm vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng, chị Hương đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương. Nhờ tay nghề khéo léo, chỉ sau một thời gian ngắn cửa hàng đã có nhiều khách quen. Thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 200USD. Vòng vốn đầu sử dụng hiệu quả, sang năm nay chị Hương tiếp tục xin vay thêm 825USD mua thêm dụng cụ làm đẹp.

loans.use: Buy tools for her beauty salon

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Cao Thi S., 47 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund for five years. As a hard-working woman, although holding two jobs, Mrs. S. still discussed with her husband to borrow money to start selling chicken in the village market. With her skills and passion, Mrs. S. easily got used to her new job. Her family income increases significantly. This time she plans to borrow 400USD to buy more chickens, which are then sold to wedding or funeral. Her family monthly income is now 250USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị S., 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ đến nay là năm thứ 5. Bản chất là người phụ nữ năng động chịu thương chịu khó, mặc dù gia đình đã có nghề phụ nhưng thời gian nhàn rỗi vẫn còn nhiều, chị đã bàn với chồng vay vốn để buôn bán gà tại chợ địa phuơng. Với bản tính khéo léo, thật thà, nhanh nhẹn nên chị S. thích nghi nhanh chóng với việc buôn bán. Kinh tế gia đình chị đi lên rõ rệt. Vòng vốn này chị dự định vay 400USD để thêm vốn đầu tư vào hàng gà phục vụ cho đám hỷ, hiếu vv... Hiện tại thu nhập bình quân của gia đình là 250USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đinh Thị Hiền, 24 years old, raises a 5 years old child by herself. Her husband has labored away from home since 2006. He sends money home regularly. Because she does not want to depend on the money from her husband, she works to support the family. She has a grocery stand at the open market as the result of the loans from the TYM Fund. The income is steady at 150USD a month. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 650USD to stock up her stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Do điều kiện làm ăn ở nhà vất vả năm 2006 chồng chị Đinh Thị Hiền, 24 tuổi, đi xuất khẩu lao động. ở nhà chỉ có mình chị và 1 con nhỏ 5 tuổi. Chồng chị cũng thường xuyên gửi tiền về nhà cho vợ. Tuy nhiện với bản chất chịu thương chịu khó, không muốn quá ỷ lại vào đồng tiền của chồng gửi về, chị tự kinh doanh để nuôi sống gia đình. Tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương được 5 năm, chị đã vay vốn mở một cửa hàng tạp hoá ở chợ. Công việc buôn bán đã đem lại thu nhập hàng ngày đều đặn và không vất vả như trước. Cửa hàng ngày càng được mở rộng, nhiều người biết đến. Vòng vốn này chị quyết định vay mức vốn 650USD để mua thêm hàng bán. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đỗ Thị Lâm, 42 years old, and her husband realize that they can not rely only to their traditional rice farming so she takes out loan to raise pigs and he works extra as a construction labor to take care of weekly payments. Her first loan with the TYM Fund five years ago was 125USD. The loan amount was increased since then. This time she is applying for a loan of 650USD to expand her pig farm. The income is steady at 180-200USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Xuất thân từ một vùng nông thôn làm ruộng thuần túy, chị Đỗ Thị Lâm, 42 tuổi, và chồng chị đều nhận thức rằng nếu chỉ làm ruộng thì sẽ không bao giờ đời sống gia đình khá giả. Vì vậy chị và anh đã bàn nhau vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, đồng thời anh đi làm thợ xây để lấy nguồn trả hàng tuần. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương, vòng vốn đầu chị vay 125USD mua lợn giống. Sau một năm, cảm thấy tham gia Quỹ rât có ích cho phát triển kinh tế gia đình, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay cao hơn. Đến nay chị đã tham gia Quỹ được 5 năm, vòng vốn này chị dự định vay 650USD để mở rộng chuồng trại, mua thêm lợn giống và lợn nái. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng từ 180-200USD.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Since the first day the TYM Fund expands to her area, Mrs. Hồ Thị Tám, 34 years old, has joined the Fund, borrowed money to invest more into her tailor shop. Her husband helps her to run the shop to. They have steady monthly income of 200USD. The family are happy with plenty of laughing from their two young children. This time she is applying for a loan of 400USD to buy material for the shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ngay từ những ngày đầu tiên Quỹ triển khai, chị Hồ Thị Tám, 34 tuổi, đã mạnh dạn tham gia để có vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng may. Mặc dù là người khéo tay nhưng khi chưa có vốn để mua vải thì việc kinh doanh cũng có nhiều trở ngại. Sau khi vay vốn, cửa hàng đã phần nào đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng, từ đó cửa hàng may của chị ngày càng đông khách. Những lúc bận việc anh cũng hộ trợ chị trong công việc để kịp tiến độ cho khách và giữ uy tín. Công việc làm ăn ngày càng phát triển, đời sống sinh hoạt được cải thiên, gia đình đầy ắp tiếng cười của 2 con trẻ. Vòng vốn này chị Tám tiếp tục vay 400USD để mua vải may. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Mrs. Meth S., 41, sells dried fish and earns about $3 a day. She is a widow who takes care of four children, one of whom contributes about $2 a day to the family by working in the garment factory, and the rest are students. She now lives with her children in the Bei Village in the Chrung Chumres I Sangkat in Phnom Penh City. Because of her business, she can help her children to go to school and pay her family’s living expenses.

She now needs a loan of $500 to buy a second-hand motorcycle to upgrade her business transportation to be more efficient. She thanks Kiva and promises to be prompt in repaying her loan

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle to upgrade her fish-selling business transportation.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba K. is a 35-year-old wife and mother of four living in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She earns a living by sewing the pants for the national suit. This outfit is an important part of Tajikistan culture: Girls often purchase a few pairs for their dowry, while women wear the suit for important occasions. As a result, Mahbuba's business is flourishing.

Mahbuba's husband recently left to earn a living abroad in Russia, so she single-handedly manages her business while raising the children. Today Mahbuba is requesting a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to buy more materials, like velour, satin, and beads, used to make her pants. Because she has an excellent credit history and reputation, she's certain that she will be able to repay the loan within six months.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and sewing materials for a tailoring business

loans.name: Bimuharam

texts.en:
Bimuharam D. is a 52-year-old wife and mother of two. She earns a living by selling food staples, such as cooking oil and soda, in a local market. Because her husband is unemployed, her business is the family's only source of income.

Today Bimuharam is requesting a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to purchase more inventory so she can expand her business. Because she has excellent credit and a solid reputation as a businesswoman, Bimuharam is certain that she'll be able to repay the loan within six months. She would also like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy food staples, such as soda and cooking oil, for a stand in a  local market

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina A. is 45-year-old wife and mother living in Kanibadam, Tajikistan. She earns a living by selling clothing, shoes, toys, baby carriages, and other goods in a local market.

Tahmina's husband supports her decision to work. Through her dedication, her business is flourishing. Now she hopes to expand her business with a loan of $675 U.S. dollars. Because she has an excellent credit history, she is confident that she will be able to pay back the loan within a year. Tahima promises to invest the money wisely and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, toys, and other goods for a local store

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Khanifa Bobeva is 41-year-old wife and mother of four children. For the past eight years, she has run a store that sells teen clothing. Through hard work, her store is now one of the most popular shops in the neighborhood.

Khanifa purchases her clothes from a nearby city called Istaravshan and even the neighboring country Uzbekistan. Today she's requesting a loan of $440 U.S. dollars so she can purchase more inventory to sell. Because Khanifa has an excellent credit history and reputation, she's sure that she will be able to pay back the loan within three months. Khanifa wants to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy clothing to expand a retail store

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
I am Rukhsana M. A. from Multan, Pakistan, a city famous for its handicrafts. I have six kids: four girls and two boys. I am borrowing for the first time from Asasah, a microfinance institute. I sell bangles and I am borrowing to expand my sales. Wedding season has just started and my sales will double, so please lend to me immediately so that I can respond to this increased demand. There are four other women in my loan group. Anweri is borrowing to fix her husband’s rickshaw. Kubra is a widow and needs this loan for her grocery store. Farzana K.'s husband supplies grocery items to various shops in the city. Nasreen’s son operates a ready-made garments business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.

loans.use: Buy bangles in bulk for the wedding season

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat I. is 47-year-old mother of five children in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the past five years, Malohat has run a children's clothing business with her family. They sew the clothing and sell them in nearby cities and even Uzbekistan, a country that neighbors Tajikistan.

Malohat is requesting a loan of $300 U.S. dollars to purchase more fabric and other goods. Because the profits are her family's main source of income, she hopes to expand her business. Because Malohat is a hard worker and has an excellent credit history, she's certain she will be able to pay the loan back within three months.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and goods for a children's clothing business

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.en:
Shahrabonu N. is a married 32-year-old mother of four children. Ever since she was just 17 years old, Shahrabonu has earned a living by selling housewares like dishes, plates, tea towels, and Thermoses in a local market.

Because of her hard work, Shahrabonu's business generates a stable income. Today she has applied for a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to buy more inventory and expand her business. The extra income will go to her family's everyday living expenses, such as food and housing. Shahrabonu has excellent credit and is certain she'll be able to pay back the loan within six months.

loans.use: To purchase dishes, plates, and other housewares for a local stand

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
My name is Parween A. and I am a group leader of four other women. These women are: Khalida, who runs a beauty parlor; Farzana B., who wants to buy a donkey cart; Haseena, who will invest her share of the loan to improve her family's vegetables business; and Rubina B., who will spend her share to fix her husband’s car.

I am 42 and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. My son runs a food stall in a busy nearby market. I also help him to prepare the snacks for his stall. He wishes to expand his business, for which he requires a loan. His income has lessened many of our economic difficulties.

loans.use: Expand food stall

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am 33, married and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. I reside with my family in the mid-size town of Multan, Pakistan. My husband has a grocery store where he sells all kinds of goods that consumers use daily. He feels that his business can do even better if he increases the inventory in his store, but he lacks the needed financing. You can help us do this through this loan.

There are several other women in my group who would like to have loans: Alia sells garments; Naheed A.’s husband is a jeweler; Saira Y. is divorced and operates a beauty salon; Humaira F. will invest her share of the loan in her family’s yarn machines.

loans.use: Increase inventory in the grocery store

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris K., a 39-year-old married father of four children, lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the past nine years, he has supported his family by building and selling doors and windowframes for houses. He opened his own store right in front of his family's home; his wife, who's pictured here, works with him to sell his goods.

Today Idris has requested a loan of $300 U.S. dollars to expand his business. Because Idris has built a reputation as an experienced woodworker (he even teaches the skill to young students now), he is confident he will be able to pay back the money within three months. As a first time lendee, Idris wants to thank everyone for trusting and supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase wood for a woodworking business

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.en:
Zulhumor O. is a married 39-year-old mother of two living in Kairakkum. For the past 12 years, Zulhumor has earned a living by selling the fabric used to make national dresses. These dresses are an important part of Tajikistan culture: Every girl must own some for her dowry, and women wear them on important occasions. As a result, Zulhumor's fabric is in high demand.

Today Zulhumor has requested a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to purchase more fabric in order to expand her business. Her income is crucial in supporting her family, and she hopes to secure a stable future for her children. Zulhumor has a solid credit history, and she is confident that she'll be able to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to expand a clothing business

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
I am Sajida Z., a leader of a small group of women: Kishwer, Zahida, Razia, Sajida and Raeesa. I have known these women for a long time and completely trust them. They need loans for the following businesses: Kishwer needs this loan for her family’s garments business; Zahida B. will buy an overlock sewing machine; Raeesa A. will use her share of the loan to repair her family's rickshaw; Razia S. needs this loan to expand her family's oil business; Sajida R. runs a boutique.

Lastly, I am aiming to buy a donkey cart for my husband. Currently he drives a rented cart, and by buying our own we will no longer have to pay the rent. For more income, I stay at home and fix sequins on stoles on order. I have five kids: three boys and two girls. I wish my kids a very bright and sound economic future.

loans.use: Buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
My name is Razia Y.. I am from Multan, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. I live in a one-room brick house with my family. I have four children: three girls and one boy. My husband runs a cloth-making power looms. He needs this loan to pay off the remaining money for the loom, which he has already bought. My group members are also requesting loans for their businesses. Zubaida B. sews and embroiders clothes on order for her neighborhood clientele. Shahnaz needs this loan for her family’s grocery store. Salma K. and Abida K. both run separate boutiques. Nadia S.’s family sells salt.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Pay off the remaining money for the cloth manufacturing loom

loans.name: Ndeeba North A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Annet is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a civil servant. She has 4 children ranging from age 14 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy food warmers.

Annet is joined in her small group by Jennifer N., Perepetwa N., Asia K., and Beatrice M.. Jennifer N. has a business selling fish and wants to add to her business. Perepetwa N. is currently operating a business producing and selling rice and wants a loan to invest in her business. Asia K. operates a business selling soft drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Beatrice M. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth material.

loans.use: To add to charcoal business

loans.name: Ndeeba North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Asiati N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Asiati is 41 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Asiati makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Asiati has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Asiati is joined in her small group by Shamim N., Sarah N., Hasifa N., and Jamawa N.. Shamim N. has a business running a hardware shop and wants to add capital. Sarah N. is currently operating a business in chicken rearing and selling and wants a loan to buy broiler mash (feed). Hasifa N. operates a business selling rice and wants to add capital. Jamawa N. is currently in the business of running a butcher's shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shop commodities

loans.name: Ndeeba North C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty O.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Betty is 36 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for her children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Loy A., Mayimuna N., Mirabu N., and Betty M.. Loy A. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Mayimuna N. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Mirabu N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to add capital. Betty M. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr. Moussa S. is a man with solid experience in poultry farming. At present he employs two members of his family part time to look after care and feeding on the farm. As the manager, he takes care of marketing and output (broiler chickens, eggs, etc.); his activities are gradually growing and he is seeking a loan to strengthen his business and to buy chicks.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Moussa S. est un homme adulte qui a une forte experience dans l’aviculture. Il emploie actuellement à temps partiel 02 membres de sa famille qui s’occupent de l’alimentation et de l’entretien de l’exploitation . En tant que gérant, il s’occupe de la commercialisation et de la production (poulets de chair, œufs etc.); son activite se developpe progressivement et il sollicite un credit pour renfocer son activite et achetr des poussins .

loans.use: Farming and marketing of chicken and eggs

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Born around 1972 in Cotonou, Mrs. Y. Antoinette is married and the mother of three children. She lives in Akpakpadodome, a shantytown in Cotonou, with her husband and sells ready-to-eat meals and assorted products. She has a lot of experience selling ready-to-eat meals which draws most of the workers from companies located near her business. Each day she is faced with high demand. She is seeking this loan in order to improve her business and to meet her customer demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1972 à COTONOU, dame Y. Antoinette est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit à AKPAKPADODOME un bidonville de COTONOU avec son mari où elle exerce ses activités de vente de repas prêt à manger et des produits divers. Elle a une grande expérience dans la vente des repas prêt à manger ce qui fait converger vers elle la majorité des travailleurs des entreprises privées implantées dans les environs de son lieu d’activité. Elle est confrontée chaque jour à une forte demande. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin d’améliorer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 sacks of beans and 7 sacks of rice

loans.name: Félix Hubert

texts.fr:
Félix Hubert M. is a very dynamic young man; being without salaried employment, he engaged himself early on in retail business to provide for his family. He now has a shop on Boulevard 54 in the Tiléne neighborhood of Ziguinchor town. He is seeking a loan to supply his shop with assorted grocery products.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Félix Hubert M. est un jeune tres dynamique ; etant sans emploi salarie , il s' est lance tres tot dans des activites de commerce de details pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille ; il tient actuellemnt une boutique sur le boulevard 54 m à Tiléne dans la ville de Ziguinchor Il sollicite un credit pour approvisionner sa boutique en produits alimentaires diverses.

loans.name: Makhtoom's Group

texts.en: I have lived all my life in the mid-size industrial city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two boys and two girls. All of my kids attend school except the youngest. I want all of my kids to finish school and find decent jobs for themselves. My husband wants to buy a new rickshaw, and therefore we need a loan. There are three other women who are also in need of loans. Samina B. requires a loan to buy a stock of various items for her son’s grocery store. Nasreen B. will buy an additional dairy cow with her share of loan. Abida B. needs this loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. These women have been together for many years and play an important role in bringing in incomes for their families.

loans.use: Buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
I am Zubaida B., a leader of a small group of women. These women are my friends, and we always help each other in time of need. Again this is a time for me to help them and request your loan not only for myself but also for them. These women need loans for the following businesses: Suriya will use the loan to buy a rickshaw for her husband; Parween B. is aiming to start a clothing sales business; Nasreen B. will use her share of the loan to pay off remaining installments of her family's rickshaw; and Rasheeda B. needs this loan to expand her grocery store.

I am a mother of two girls, one of whom is married. My husband is a daily wage laborer, and we also have a rickshaw that we have rented out. These two ventures provide us a decent household income. Now the rickshaw needs maintenance and we thus require a loan.

loans.use: Fix rickshaw

My husband is a daily wage laborer and earns very little, which is insufficient to meet our household expenses. Therefore my husband has decided to start a fruit cart on a nearby bus platform. He hopes this will increase our income substantially. There are four other women in my loan group who are in need of loans. Sakina is acquiring a loan for her son, who has a motorbike business. Rukhsana B. will use the loan to improve her family's restaurant. Shamim needs this loan for her husband, who is a butcher. Shamshad requires the loan for her husband's electronics repair store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and we are mutually responsible for the repayment of the loan.

Parween A. will invest the loan in her husband’s CD and movie shop; Sajida B. requires a loan to buy a rickshaw in installments; Wazira B. needs this loan to expand her family's fruit business; and Nazia B. is borrowing for her bother, who sells watches.

The group leader of this small group is Janet K.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to purchase more matooke from the surrounding villages. Janet is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from age 18 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Janet makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a goat. Janet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Janet is joined in her small group by Beatrice M., Edith N., Joy N., and Fatuma M.. Beatrice M. has a business trading produce and wants to boost business. Edith N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Joy N. operates a business of produce sales and wants to invest in her business. Fatuma M. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To boost matooke selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix the outside appearance of his restaurants

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa was born in 1960 and she lives in  Kaćuni , a near place called Busovača. Her husband does season work and he earns about 250 KM monthly. When he is not working, they are do agriculture work and sell milk and milk products. They have a big family with 3 children, from 17-25 years old and they need additional money for their living. Latifa intends to use this loan in the amount of 500 KM for animal nutrition. She wants to secure a better sale of her milk products in order to secure a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: Animal nutrition.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en: Sabira is from Kaćuni, a small place near Busovača. She was born in 1964 and has a 23 year old child.  Her husband does season work and he can earn about 200 KM monthly. They are doing agriculture, too. When her husband does not have a job, they sell milk and milk products. Sabira took this loan in the amount of 1000 KM and she is going to invest in buying stock and animal nutrition. Her intention is to expand her business and enlarge the number of poultry.

loans.use: Buying a stock and animal nutrition.

loans.name: Radmila

texts.en: Radmila is from the town of Zenica and she was born in 1952. She is divorced and her only monthly income is her pension. She has 3 adult children  25, 30 and 31 years old. She enjoys stitching  and Radmila took this loan in the amount of 1500 KM  to buy wool for stitching and knitting. She wants to accomplish  her pension days.

loans.use: Buying wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in greater variety of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en: Ernesa is a 24 year old woman from Zenica and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and  he can earn about 850 KM monthly. They get additional money by selling her handmade work. She does stiching and knitting. Ernesa will invest this loan in the amount of 1500 KM for kniting supplies in order to improve their monthly income.

loans.use: Invest in knitting.

loans.name: Milijana

texts.en: Milijana was born in 1984 and she is from Zenica.  She is doing stitching and this loan in the amount of  1500 KM she intends to use for buying material for stitching.  Milijana is divorced and she has a child who is 3 years old. She gets monthly alimony. Milijana thinks that the supply of material will help her to improve her business and that she will manage to secure a safe future for her and her little son.

loans.use: Buying material for stitching.

loans.name: Ljubina

texts.en: Ljubina is from Srebrenica and she lives with her husband and their 2 children. Her husband works private as a constructor  and he earns about 1200 KM monthly. They have additional income by selling raspberries, blackberries and breeding poultry. Ljubina took this loan in the amount of 1200 KM to buy raspberry seedlings, streak and fertilizer for her raspberry acres in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying raspberry seedlings.

loans.name: Branka

texts.en: Branka is a 54 year old woman who lives  with her husband and her mother in town Bratunac. Her husband has 1000 KM monthly pension and they dont have children. Branka will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM for buying swines for good. She thinks that this investment will be good for their future income.

loans.use: Buying swines.

loans.name: Begajeta

texts.en: Begajeta was born in 1962 and she is widow. She lives in a small village Lukavica near the town Gračanica with her 2 daughters, 15 and 17 years old. This is her fourth loan at MCO WWI. This loan in the amount of 600 KM will go toward buying chicken and feed for stock in order to improve her monthly household income.

loans.use: Buying chicken and feed for stock.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is from village Lukavica, near town Gračanica. She was born in 1968 and she is divorced. She lives with her mother  and daughter, 16 years old. Fatima works as a season cook in Croatia and she can earn about 1500- 2000 Euro in a season. She will use this loan in the amount of 600 KM to build a greenhouse and buy seedlings for it. She wants a secure, safe business for the whole year and not just for a season.

loans.use: For greenhouse and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Work toward buying and renovating his own bakery

loans.name: Amra

texts.en: Amra lives in Miričina, a small suburb of Gračanica. She was born in 1985 and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 1000 KM. This is her first loan in the amount of  800 KM and Amra intends to use it for buying chicken and honey production.  She hopes that she will earn some additional money for her household.

loans.use: Buying chicken and honey for production.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 28 year old woman from Orahovica, a small place near town Gračanica. She is married and she has daughter, 11, who attends primary school. Her husband has a full-time job and he earns about 800 KM monthly. Azra will use this loan in the amount of 800 KM for purchasing chickens and buying animal nutrition in order to increase their monthly incomes. For them, 800 KM monthly is not enough for their living costs.

loans.use: Buying animal nutrition.

loans.name: Nervina

texts.en: Nervina lives in Miričina, a small suburb of Gračanica. She is a 41 year old woman and she is married. Her husband is the owner of a small drug store and they can earn about 1000 KM. They have two children, 17 and 22 years old. This is not her first loan at MCO WWI. Nervina will use this loan in the amount of  1500 KM  for buying a cow. Her wish is to buy one more cow and improve her monthly income in order to improve education standards for her children.

loans.use: Buy one more cow.

loans.name: Safeta

texts.en: Safeta was born in 1968 and she is from Crijevčići, a small suburb of town Živinice. Her husband is self-employed and he earns about 400 KM monthly. They get additional money from cattle breeding. They have two children and are receiving 80 KM child support. Safeta intends to use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM for buying animal nutrition for a cow and heifer. Her intention is to keep her animals healthy and continue to earn a monthly income.

loans.use: Buying nutritional food for her animals.

loans.name: Jasminka

texts.en: Jasminka was born in 1977 and she lives in Golubinjak, a suburb of town Živinice. She is divorced and has one child. She receives monthly alimony for her son in the amount of  50 KM. This is her first loan in the amount of 1000 KM and Jasminka will use it for buying  foil for strawberries. Her wish is to expand her strawberry  patch.

loans.use: Buying  foil for strawberries.
